American summer blockbuster hit that ignites box office booths when most others are floundering and while there's a chance this Ryan Gosling and Emily Blunt starring action comedy does make a decent dent at the global box office, Leitch's well-intentioned big budget affair is sadly another recent blockbuster that doesn't hit the mark.An amalgamation of a bevy of ideas, Fall Guy acts as a crowd-pleasing action ride, a generic romantic comedy centred around Gosling's long-suffering stuntman Colt Seavers and Blunt's up and coming director Jody Moreno, a love letter to the stunt community and an underdeveloped mystery that see's Seavers enlisted to help track down Aaron Taylor-Johnson's missing Hollywood leading man Tom Ryder.With this in mind, no one can accuse Leitch's film of resting on its laurels but despite appearing to have its heart in the right place, too much of Fall Guy feels forced, underdeveloped and at the same time overstated, making this a a film likely to appease easy going audiences initially but a film that disappears from people's memories before a second thought.A one time stuntman himself, David Leitch has found success over the past decade with his ability to instil many of his films with the right amount of zany energy, comedic chops and action beats, with his work on successful outings such as Deadpool 2 and the highly underrated at the time Bullet Train perfect examples of the type of film Fall Guy wants to be and with it missing the mark in many of the elements that made those films so much fun, at the very least you'd expect the action heavy segments of Fall Guy too fly but even the key action moments here never take off, with no set pieces likely to be considered again once the next scene rolls around.Trying to be so many things at any one time, there's a distinct lack of focus that embodies Fall Guy's long in the tooth runtime that runs out of steam early, picks up momentum when Seavers rolls into Sydney after a long term hiatus in the industry and then loses significant amounts of good will and energy when a quite terrible last act takes hold, with this lack of focus constantly bringing any wins the film has back to earth, no more evident than in the films constant back and forwards between events on the set of Seavers and Moreno's new movie, Seavers investigation into Ryder's disappearance and then Gosling and Blunt's forced feeling will they or won't they romance.With so many things going on and film struggling to deliver on the spectacle front, hopes of Fall Guy being saved on the comedic front are not too be found with minor chuckles the order of the day as many of the films big set-ups and over-delivered back and forwards lacking the smarts or charms that could've made even some of the minor potential moments something worth celebrating with Fall Guy also in particular marking a moment in Gosling's career as it stands where his schtick that his finely attuned over the most recent parts of his career showing genuine wear and tear.Not playing the exact same pretty dumb he did with The Nice Guys or Barbie or the sleek comedic charmer he did with La La Land or Crazy, Stupid, Love. There's still a sense of over familiarity with Gosling's turn as the potentially genius/potentially misguided Seavers and there's not many moments in Fall Guy where you feel Gosling is really owning proceedings here, marking this role down as a key career moment for the beloved star where he will either continue to bunker down with this type of project or start to recognise it is perhaps time he gave this version of Gosling the A-lister a rest.A well-intentioned film and entirely inoffensive, there's glimpses of the film Fall Guy just might have been and there's going to be some fans of the film unearthed no doubt but overall this films the exact type of forgettable Hollywood film the industry really didn't need right now.Final Say -Failing to excel in the action or comedic stakes and unable to do much with the chemistry between Gosling and Blunt that could've been mined far greater than it was here, The Fall Guy is a disappointingly lacklustre and disjointed outing that has strangely been greeted with a far kinder critical reception than it deserves.2 unicorns out of 5Jordan and Eddie (The Movie Guys)

title: Best fun I've had at the movies in years.
text: I recently bought the 80s show "The Fall Guy" starring Lee Majors and the disgustingly hideous, vomit inducing Heather Thomas 😉. I saw a few episodes as reruns when I was a kid. About a month and a half ago I bought the first season on Amazon and I've been working my way through it and I love the show. When I bought it I had no idea whatsoever that they were making a movie of it. Turns out that movie came out this last weekend and I saw it on Saturday. I loved it. It was probably the best experience I've had at the theater since I can remember. It's a cheesy love story comedic murder mystery action movie kind of thing and it's a showpiece for cool stunts and it was downright delightful. It is not a modern take on the television show. They keep the character names and the fact the main character is a stuntman but the story is a complete reimagining that does its own thing. I liked that because it doesn't compete with the show. It stands on its own merits. They did pack it with Easter Egg homages to the show though. Only complaint is they didn't tell you explicitly it had been a Tv show but I loved the cameo in the credits. Highly recommend both the show and movie. This movie is endearing and sweet, yet cleverly meta at the same time.

title: A fabulous homage to the stuntman
text: This movie pays homage to the stunt men ( and women) of movies who go through hell while getting filmed doing dangerous stunts. They jump from heights, they get banged up in car crashes, get burnt in fire scenes but at the end of the action scene they show a "thumbs up" to the relief of the director and crew. So is the life of stuntman Colt Seavers ( Ryan Gosling) who goes through this ordeal with supreme confidence and coolness. His ambitious director Jody ( Emily Blunt) is making this movie about cowboys and aliens within the movie. Fabulous is the word for this movie with eight and a half car rolls in the action sequences.There is something fascinating about a movie which is showing a movie being shot within a movie. There is plenty of stuff for the movie buff. There are a number of "behind the scene" revelations specially from the stuntman's point of view. There are references to iconic movies like " Pretty woman", " Notting Hill", " The fugitive " ," Thelma and Louise" among others while the stuntman and the director converse. An interesting scene is when they discuss the pros and cons of a split screen and the visual goes into split screen. Another scene shows improvisation of dialogue on the set of a sea beach in the midst of chaotic action when director Jody asks Ryan what should be his reaction in a scene and he in turn asks the co actors. A democratic way to shoot a movie indeed. One tends to think thinks that movie making is now more technology centric and less content oriented. The stuntman's job is described as "nihilistic" by the director Jody. There is plenty of action, comedy, self spoofing and parody for continuous entertainment. Towards the end a song brings out an appealing thought of a stuntman who says he doesn't want a statuette for his work, the scars are enough reward.Director David Leitch's homage to the stunt man makes for an excellent movie. The exciting visuals, the peppy songs, the sparkling dialogue are all engrossing. A thrilling climax is shot in Sydney. The cinematography and editing are top class. Ryan unleashes his charishma and swagger all throughout as only he can. ( A much needed contrast to Ken of Barbie). Emily acts well as Jody the animated director of the movie. Together their chemistry is great and carries the movie splendidly.

title: Celebration of behind the camera
text: What a great popcorn film this is. Action scenes are diligently executed. Acting is over the top. Of course Ryan Gosling is doing the superstar Ryan Gosling things. He is freaking awesome. I can see him easily replacing Tom Cruise as THE action star.Emily Blunt is a scene stealer too. At some point film might bore you with long dialogs but don't forget that this is also a romantic film.The best thing about this film is they are constantly reminding the audience that all these actions films couldn't be possible to make without awesome people working behind the camera. We should all be thankful for their hard-work. And yes, as it was mentioned in the film, there should be awards for the film crews! They absolutely don't get enough credit!Cheers to them 🥂

title: For prepubescents
text:
There have been so many reviews on this one, so I'll keep it brief.Driver, starring Ryan Gosling, and Emily Blunt's Edge of Tomorrow are favourites of mine. That is why I started watching..
This film contains elements of both environments, but nothing else.How can these actors not leave after the first shot? They must notice the difference in the quality of the drafting, story, and dialogue.Okay, this is a comedy, but stupid jokes seen a thousand times, such as a dog biting in the pants, are not entertaining at all. I waited 40 minutes for the plot, but there was none, and when it was disclosed, it was so rudimentary.When it becomes a torment to watch a comedy all the way through, I have to realise it was not meant for me. And I doubt I would have liked it if I were 50 years younger.Have you been warned. No Movie for Old Men.I give it four stars since it finds its audience and is professionally produced.

title: Tremendous
text: The Fall Guy is a captivating cinematic experience that effortlessly blends action, romance, and drama into an unforgettable narrative. Ryan Gosling's charismatic performance as a stuntman striving to prove himself adds depth to the storyline, while Emily Blunt's portrayal of the director, his love interest, adds a layer of complexity. The chemistry between the two leads is palpable, enhancing the emotional resonance of the film. The expertly choreographed action sequences keep audiences on the edge of their seats, complemented by a dynamic soundtrack that heightens the intensity of each scene. Overall, ""The Fall Guy"" is a must-watch for anyone seeking thrilling entertainment and compelling storytelling.

title: Good surprise movie it is soo good !
text: Honestly I expected a typical " Action-Comedy " from Hollywood with some two or three nice action scenes and bad jokes lines like we used to watching but this movie is very nice surprise !First to all the film as a whole is very entertaining thanks to notably his script is very very nice cause is very engaging you don't feel not all boring or annoying in front of it and this is typical script where there are a lots of twists and turns and a whole lot of meaning, usually we don't expect a nice story in this type of movie but " The Fall Guy " can to stand-out as the main idea of the story, making a movie about the stunt man on set of a film is pretty interesting it's not a miss !!!!Accompanied of nice mystery storytelling from the script who are again very well and gripping the stunt show up all long the movie is very nice, we know who say thank you from his all skills... The lights and sets are really nice I thought all scenes of this movie was only inside of a studio with a lot CGI well...no is very good point !The duo of Ryan Gosling and Emily Blunt from the original movie of Barbenheimer ;) makes a good fusion of actors together, I hope so at the futur a new project with them together !Only light issue is too Hight CGI on several scenes of action that's normal even I expected a lot from that and even a film just for this but it's disappointing that the industry of Hollywood rather to making CGI than earlier like more realistic film set effects.Anyhow this movie is very nice and good moment to watching in theaters :)

title: Honoring Stuntmen: 'The Fall Guy' Delivers Heart, Action, and Tribute
text: What sets ""The Fall Guy"" apart is its dedication to honoring the unsung heroes of the film industry: the stuntmen. Through breathtaking action sequences and heartfelt performances, it pays tribute to their skill and bravery. Gosling and Blunt's chemistry is palpable, adding an extra layer of excitement to the film. The comedic timing of the cast is impeccable, providing moments of levity amidst the intense action. With its engaging plot and charismatic leads, ""The Fall Guy"" is a cinematic gem that deserves to be seen by audiences everywhere. A heartfelt tribute to stuntmen, 'The Fall Guy' delivers thrilling action, genuine performances, and undeniable charm.

title: Pretty Rubbish
text: The film was a great disappointment. The director and writer didn't know what type of film they were making. The plot is non exstiant and doesn't make a lot of sense. I thought this was a action/comedy but wasn't funny at all, didn't laugh or chuckle once. The 1st half of the film was so boring, I was gradually closing my eyes. Everything was so predictable..I feel sorry for the cast and need to sack their agent for putting them forward for this film. Its a absolutely dreadful film.Save your money and watch a amateur film on YouTube which are a lot better, funny, actioned packed and well directed.

title: As much fun as movies get
text: What doesn't this movie have? Nothing. A list stars doing their A list thing. Check. Great action. Check. Duh. Comedy. Check. Sci Fi. Check. Soundtrack. Check. Meta in jokes. Check. Cute Dog. Check.Can not remember the last time I had this much fun at the movies. Spill the popcorn out loud belly laughs with mouth agape Oh No They Didn't stunts and just enough emotional gravitas to keep it all from being too campy. Ryan Gosling apparently can do anything while looking amazing and Emily Blunt just could not be more precious and / or precocious. Aaron-Taylor Johnson plays a heal with absolute believability and Hannah Waddingham once again proves that the whole world has been sleeping on her for far too long. I'd pay to see it again.

title: Amazing ride, this is the Driver when he was young
text: Great respect to the stunt men and women - one thumb up! It is all just a jet lag.Convoluted plot, needs more then a one time to watch definitely.It is a great comedy/satire/irony with many elements of truth and sacrifices that come with the profession. Some viewers might not understand the jokes, and the plot and the innuendoes, because plot is ...Enjoyable visually- an eye fest- yes! - action scenes-yes!--acting is good, and sometimes maybe improvised? And maybe a love story?Replayability of the movie over years -almost endless. One to keep in your library.There are some awesome cameo appearances!Do not forget to watch the end credits, where they show the actual stunts, and the triple doubles.

title: When the end credits are the most exiting part of your movie, something is off.
text: I love the art of stunts and when the director introduces his movie by saying he is a stuntman, that sets a high bar for what's to come. But I feel bad for stuntmen if this is the representation they get. Action scenes are extremely unbelievable, but that's not the biggest problem. They are so fake that it completely brings you out of the movie. No hits seem to land and at one point you wouldn't even know what's going on if it weren't for a loud bite sound. The sound design is carrying the action hard in this movie.The rest of the movie is even worse. A missing person case turns into a murder case and all of the usual twists and turns unfolds. But this feels like the subplot of an entire different movie. It's supposed to be a romantic movie, but that's pushed aside for this storyline that just wastes time instead of developing the movies strengths. Ryan Gosling and Emily Blunt. While they don't get a lot from the script, at least they do their jobs as actors and has somewhat of a chemistry. The problem is that they have so little screen time that just makes the movie drag in between. If you are going to be a clichéd romantic action movie, why not just follow a working formula where they are both in this together instead of having them on separate places all the time? Instead we have a movie that doesn't know if it wants to be romance or action.Then we have the script. As said before, there are clichés all over the place which makes the story so predictable that it's hard to be excited for what's coming next as it feels more like a confirmation of what you were waiting for. The dialogue is terrible and it proves how good Ryan Gosling and Emily Blunt is as actors to be able to deliver them with at least some credibility. Too bad both the script and the editing kills any subtlety they are delivering and instead wants the audience to know exactly how "smart" it is.This leaves a two star rating, one for Gosling and one for Blunt. The best part of the movie is the end credits where you get to see how the stunts were made.

title: MOVIE WITHIN A MOVIE
text: PERFECT DATE MOVIE!!I love the concept of movie within a movie!! I took my wife and step son to see this, I don't really care for gosling to much, he is self absorbed and a pretty boy. Remember the Titans and Notebook was his 2 best movies.This movie and roll fit him and his persona, very well. Their wasn't a dull moment in this picture. I was very hesitant on seeing this because of Gosling. But, I sat through it and enjoyed it.We love how they didn't add too many characters to the storyline. You only need the hero and the co-hero, plus the bad guy and the co-bad guy. Prime example of this theory was Ghostbuster 4. Too many characters involved.We love how they added Jason Mamoa to the ending. This was his movie as well. This makes Aquaman put to shame.It really dives into the life of a stuntman and the mindset of one. Watch it and it's a must.

title: Superb movie
text: The Fall Guy is a thrilling rollercoaster of a movie, blending heart-stopping action with genuine emotion. Ryan Gosling and Emily Blunt deliver stellar performances, perfectly capturing the highs and lows of their characters' journey. Their chemistry is undeniable, adding depth and complexity to the film. But what truly sets "The Fall Guy" apart is its celebration of stuntmen. Each action sequence is a testament to their skill and bravery, reminding audiences of the hard work that goes on behind the scenes. With its adrenaline-fueled thrills and heartfelt moments, this movie is a true crowd-pleaser that shouldn't be missed.

title: 20 minutes, switched it off.
text: Boring/10.Lifeless action without much action. There's a fall, a car flip and some interaction between the stars Ryan Gosling and Emily Blunt, there's no spark or chemistry there and it's padded out with jokes that seem to be aimed at tweens.Hollywood's dying - and maybe that's the joke here, but it's not a very good joke and the timing's off. Whoever wrote this deserves a day out at Microsoft/chatGPT/whatever. I've always been mystified by Gosling's "lead man" status, he did United States of Leland and Half Nelson which were both pretty good, but I've found him wooden and uninteresting in pretty much everything else since and that lack of interest gets further cemented here. Still, enjoy the money Ryan, it's looking to be a future of straight to video on demand... Speaking of which, this film may well have been better used on Tubi and may at least have come with a director that has a sense of humour.Yeah, 20 minutes, not worth the time investment to finish, if you're watching this on Netflix, there's almost certainly something better on Amazon or vice/versa.

title: Fabulous one
text: The Fall Guy delivers an exhilarating cinematic experience that's perfect for a weekend outing with friends and family. Ryan Gosling's charismatic performance, especially in action scenes, and Emily Blunt's charm elevate the film to new heights. The storyline of a stuntman's journey to become a real-life hero and win over his love, who happens to be the film's director, adds depth to the thrilling narrative. The fast-paced action sequences and captivating music further immerse viewers into the story, making it a must-watch for action enthusiasts. The Fall Guy is a masterclass in storytelling, with Ryan Gosling and Emily Blunt delivering standout performances. The film's exploration of love, redemption, and the pursuit of dreams resonates deeply, leaving a lasting impression on audiences.

title: Better than the trailer made it look
text: Going into the movie I felt that it was a romance with random action scenes. It's actually an action movie that has romance in it. This smart direction allows the film to do what it wants to do which is to be a "love letter" to stuntmen as well as general movie making. And the stunts are done very well!Smartly, we know the motivations of our main leads. They don't have to come out and say where things can lead. Will the fall guy win back the director? The outcome is possible, but only if he does and says the correct things. Explain why he left her. Win her back. Prove he's worth another chance. The fact that he has to use his stunt skills to keep his job and therefore stay on the film set around his former girlfriend is a great way to show his loyal need to the film production, but also his willingness to prove his worth to her. Along the way, we get meta conversations that are tied together with filming and editing techniques. We get drug-fueled visuals, comedy, and impressive action that continues to prove why cgi should be used sparingly.Of course not everything makes total sense. But the movie is a lot of fun and makes you not care about these small drawbacks, although the ending seems to have been re-shot. One ending was set up and would've worked very well on multiple points, but we are treated to something that ends the movie on a bit of a bum note. Overall, though, it succeeds with memorable action, great chemistry, and mostly satisfying third act.

title: An enjoyable night at the cinema
text: If this is a success I am sure we'll be seeing Knight Rider, Airwolf (and who could forget BJ and the Bear) all coming to a multiplex near you in a summer or two.Colt Seavers is the guy with the coolest name and coolest job in town. But in the 2020s he's now updated to have feelings. Did that ever happen back in the day?I do think that the Emily Blunt role was set up for someone else. The change of her characters name from Jodie Banks to Jodie Moreno makes no sense when there's a British actor in the role. Love her but somehow she seems a bit too nice to be a director in charge of millions of spend.Cameos at the end were well received and together with a few winks with the 6 Million Dollar Man sound effects used too.Gosling is a fantastic star who doesn't take himself seriously.I'd love a sequel in a year or two. But please. No BJ and the Bear.

title: Gosling and Blunt are Crushed by Bloated Run Time
text: Let's get some postives out of the way. One of which are; The two leads, there charisma and charm is one of the few reasons this movie was tolereble. The action was also handled with Leitch's flare. Which is becoming a trademark when it comes to action set pieces. The shots where we were watching a film being made was well choreographed. And Finally there's a cameo that made me grin ear to ear(involving the final shot of the film they were making).Now lets talk about the elephent in the room. Which is the over inflated run time, there are dialogs in this film that span for five minutes but feels like twenty. They added no depth to the characters and did nothing to progress the story. The marketing of this movie reminded me of Goslings other film The Nice Guys(2016) a detective -noir film that I love and was hoping to get a similar experience here, but alas it's nothing like it. The story telling felt like it was inspired by Kiss Kiss Bang Bang(2005) which is a fantastic film by the way. But comparing it with this would be insulting to Downey Jr. And to add insult to injury the plot of the movie is predictable. Not a quality you want in any movie. The concept of the film is one that actually demands respect but the fear of commitment to it's core story is a main reason it stumbles.

title: Must watch
text: In addition to its gripping action and compelling narrative, The Fall Guy also excels in its character development and emotional resonance. As the protagonist grapples with his inner demons and strives to prove himself to the woman he loves, viewers are taken on an emotional rollercoaster of highs and lows. Ryan Gosling's nuanced portrayal of the flawed yet endearing stuntman is a standout, earning him praise from audiences and critics alike. Emily Blunt shines in her role as the director torn between professional ambition and personal attachment, delivering a performance that is both captivating and emotionally resonant.

title: a great overhated action-comedy
text:
"The Fall Guy" is a great action comedy. The word of mouth of this film is not very positive and therefore I went to the cinema without expectations, only with the thought of having fun and a little fun. But it turned out to be something else! This film perfectly mixes action and comedy through the great work done by the actors, with Ryan Gosling, Emily Blunt and Aaron Taylor-Johnson at high levels and who perfectly interpret their characters. The surprising thing about this film is that it is a film inside the film: this movie is about Colt, a stuntman, who after a serious accident retires. One day, however, he returns to the track with a new job offer and this will lead him to reconcile with many old friends and to live dangerous and unforgettable adventures. In fact, the weak points of the film are the plot and the writing, very simple, but I don't think they are ugly, on the contrary, I liked them. And then, to be clear, these films do not need an incredible plot, the important thing is that they are films that entertain the viewer with a bit of madness! The characters are all beautifully characterized and in-depth and I loved the friendship and romance between Colt and Jody, a perfect couple. But I also loved Dan thanks to the performance of Winston Duke that always drives me crazy, I laughed like a child. Also in my opinion in this film there is also drama and sadness, mixed perfectly and there is a scene on which I was going to cry, an unforgettable scene. The rhythm of the film is absurd, there was not a moment when I got bored. Leitch's direction is excellent with an incredible photograph, in my opinion this film and "Bullet Train" are on the same level, perhaps slightly higher for the soundtracks, the best point of the film. I loved the ending and this movie is probably one of my "comfort films". I can't wait to see it again digitally..
Rating: 8.8/10.

title: Thrilling Blend of Action and Character Excellence
text: I watched "Fall Guy" and I absolutely loved it! Every detail of the film is so well thought out, from the rich references to the emphasis on background heroes who are usually overlooked, which really impressed me. As for the action scenes, there's only one thing to say: they're phenomenal! It's been a long time since I've seen action scenes this satisfying.When it comes to the performances of Ryan Gosling and Emily Blunt, both were flawless. Every scene is elevated to another dimension with their talents. Emily's charisma and Ryan's convincing performance kept me glued to the screen throughout the film. If you like this kind of action movie, "Fall Guy" is definitely not to be missed. Watch it, you won't regret it!

title: Why did I waste my time
text: This movie was the worst movie I have seen in a long time. There was no story line. It was such a waste of time. They introduce characters... including dogs and confuse the heck out of you. What on earth. I, along with my friends are speechless... and disgusted that we actually spent $24.00 to watch this. The only positive I have, is that we didn't waste our time and see it at the theater. No thanks. Say no to this awful awful movie. If you choose to watch it, know that there is no story line. It makes no sense. You will waste way too much time of your precious life. Just say no. Dont buy. Don't watch. Don't waste your time.

title: Exciting plot, full of action
text: Super entertaining, movie within a movie. Not much depth but thoroughly enjoyable. The plot is exciting, with twists and turns. Ryan Gosling delivered with the stunts, but could emote more on the romantic scenes. Emily Blunt brought the heart. Aaron Taylor Johnson was hilarious. Great humor overall. Movie within a movie, actor playing a stuntman with a real life stuntman doing the stunts, lots of meta-ness. Wish there were more development of the romance. Great music and old action movie references. Overall, a fun watch. My 11 year old son loved it, he's the one who's made me give it a 9/10 rating.

title: Electrifying ⚡
text: The Fall Guy is a cinematic marvel that seamlessly blends action, comedy, and heartfelt storytelling. Ryan Gosling and Emily Blunt's on-screen chemistry is electrifying, breathing life into their characters and captivating audiences from start to finish. What sets this film apart is its tribute to the unsung heroes of the film industry: stuntmen. Through adrenaline-pumping action sequences, ""The Fall Guy"" pays homage to their dedication and skill, elevating the movie to new heights. This summer, make sure to catch this action-packed drama that delivers thrills, laughs, and a refreshing take on the genre.

title: Falling Guy
text: The Fall Guy 2024 is trying far too hard to be funny and clever.It bears little resemblance to the fun original TV series starring Lee Majors.The original show was everything the film is not.A total throwaway and forgettable film.Obviously lots of stunts that look ok but it ha a real B movie feel to it. It was made for film insiders to add little jokes that only they understand.The relationship between Emily Blunt and Ryan Gosling very quickly becomes boring and tedious.In reality it should be a 20 min short story with 30 mins of action sequence.I can only recommend this film if you are aged between 10 and 16 and who has never seen a good movie before.

title: It's a rare film
text: "In a cinematic landscape often saturated with reboots and sequels, ""The Fall Guy"" stands out as a breath of fresh air. Its homage to the unsung heroes of Hollywood, combined with top-notch performances and expertly choreographed action, cements its status as a modern classic. Don't miss your chance to experience the thrill ride that is ""The Fall Guy.""" What sets this film apart is its respectful nod to the stunt community, showcasing the risks they take to bring our favorite action sequences to life. It's a rare film that manages to be both a pulse-pounding action fest and a thoughtful examination of the people behind the scenes.

title: This was so much Fun
text: I had a great night at the movies with this film. This was so much fun! I was chearing for the characters in my seat. RG is really good in this (and looking good), the humor is exellent, the stunts and the action are impressive an exiting, music (I was made for loving you!) and co-stars, everything was perfect. And some really nice surprises at the end. Dont overthink it, its just great entertainment and an interesting look behind the scenes. OK, from the original Colt-Seavers-Series there was nothing left than the names, but it doesnt matter. The movie works on its own. Go see it and have fun! Well done!

title: Brilliantly done
text: I finally got round to watching this film in the cinema yesterday and it did not disappoint. The Fall Guy has everything I could ask for. Ryan and Emily have wonderful chemistry and work so well together. It's loaded with action and touches of comedy to keep it light-hearted and fun.The best thing about it is that it's easy to follow. There aren't any dramatic plot twists that make the storyline confusing and no overwhelming camera cuts which is refreshing. Overall, this is one of those casual shut-your-brain off action/comedy films that anyone can enjoy and I'd definitely suggest checking it out.

title: Stuntmen Unleashed: The Fall Guy
text: The Fall Guy is a stellar cinematic experience that excels in every aspect. From the dynamic performances of Ryan Gosling and Emily Blunt to the adrenaline-pumping action sequences, this film captivates from start to finish. It's refreshing to see a movie centered around stuntmen, paying homage to the unsung heroes behind the scenes. The chemistry between Gosling and Blunt is electric, elevating the film's charm to new heights. Moreover, the comedic elements are expertly woven into the narrative, adding depth and entertainment value. If you're looking for a summer blockbuster that delivers on all fronts, ""The Fall Guy"" is a must-watch.

title: Comedy with Action!!
text: Very good hangout movie. The action scenes were so good, and knowing that none of them were CGI makes me more fascinated. The Chemistry of Jody and Colt (Emily & Ryan) was so smooth and amazing,, and they also nailed it with the soundtracks. Incredible to watch. Some parts of the movies were pure comedy, which will surely make everyone laugh. The cast was cool, and to be honest, I liked the costumes most. There is just so much to love about this movie, and it's a thrilling introduction to the summer season. I had an absolute blast with it!Go and watch this in theaters if that's available, because my experience was phenomenal.

title: Edge-of-Your-Seat Action Meets Compelling Storytelling in 'The Fall Guy
text: Rarely does a film come along that combines heart-pounding action with a compelling storyline, but ""The Fall Guy"" achieves just that. With a perfect blend of intensity and emotion, it keeps viewers on the edge of their seats throughout. Gosling and Blunt shine in their roles, bringing depth and authenticity to their characters. The film's exploration of the world of stuntmen adds a unique and intriguing layer to the story, shedding light on an often-overlooked aspect of filmmaking. From the jaw-dropping stunts to the witty dialogue, every aspect of ""The Fall Guy"" is executed with precision and flair."

title: Sat thru it but ...
text: Out of respect for the magnificent & life changing art form that is - film...&.the admiration for the always memorable & super talented actors -Ryan Gosling & Emily Blunt, & for the recognition of film stunt people & all they achieve at great risk.....I sat thru this ....but sadly this film had none if these qualities as the script was so dire, & it was so cheesy it was cringeworthy. Awful really. I think this film is love it or loathe it. It came across as a B movie but of course it is not. It really could not find it's ground ...a total mish- mash.Someone give these two fantastic actors some worthy stuff.

title: AMAZING MOVIE!!
text: This was such an amazing movie "360"! It was all it said it would be & MORE! Can't believe those negative Nellie's! I haven't seen a movie I throughly enjoyed like this in far too long.. SHOULD BE 10'ssss ALL AROUND 🤠I agree this movie is like a love letter to all the stunt men and women who risk it all to make amazing movies and quite frankly make the actual "movie stars"! It's hard work and under rated.. there should be some kind of recognition for the brave souls willing to be flung around & battered to make great films! The behind the scenes looked like this film was absolutely amazing to be a part of!

title: OMG I Love The Fall Guy, the best performane RG has ever done!
text: The movie starts with RG being a bad ass with the song "I was made for loving you baby, you were made for loving me. I can't get enough of you baby, you can't get enough of me!" The music just matches the vibe of the movie so well with the other cast and the love story it fits sooooo well! Ryan just had the performance of his life doing this, this really elevates his career in filming. Instead of just staring out a window in a car and not doing anything and not doing any acting at all whatsoever, he actually acts in this movie and actually performs in this movie. Instead of his other movies where he does nothing at all besiding looking okay and staring at the camera for screen time. For example in remember the titans, he is literally there just for diversity and looking good. In Fall Guy he actually acts and takes the role of a main characer improving the movie. All the stunts(even though it was done by a stuntman) he still looks very good in the stunts. Overall this is just so perfect ryan just showed that he can do other things other than staring at the camera doing nothing. I love this movie!!!!! :3.

title: A Different Entertaining Rom-Com
text: This Ryan Gosling and Emily Blunt rom-com while a typically seven out of ten movie entertainment makes an upgrade to eight because of the directorial and writer's risk taking in attempting a storyline that deviants from more predictable, traditional movie plots. With a charming number of add on ending credit scenes and the atypical use of a split screen scene, The Fall Guy focuses on the behind the scenes role of stunt doubles and a rather convoluted mystery behind the disappearance of the main star of the science fiction action adventure movie within a movie. The romantic undertones and overtones between Ryan Gosling as a talented stunt double and Emily Blunt as a camera woman with higher ambitions have already started off before the movie even begins and proceeds to evolve over the course of the entire movie with good moments between the two actors. The action, drama, and the comedy are fused together in a difficult balance that eventually succeeds on the screen. The Fall Guy is entertaining and well done with a carefully but difficult to edit into a creative and somewhat unusual and entertaining storyline.

title: A beautiful homage to the industry and the stunt community
text: The movie pays homage not only to the stunt community, but to the whole industry, using metalanguage to show the industry from the inside.For the people who love the industry of filmmaking, for the people who love some good action and good stunts, and for the people who love a good love story, this movie will be good for you.All three acts are well presented, the filmmaking is great, the sound and soundtrack are perfect, and Ryan and Emily's acting are just amazing. The chemistry between the two, what they bring to the screen, to the story, it's all perfect.With a good amount of humour, the movie is perfect to watch with friends, family, partners. Basically, it checks all the boxes: good story, stunts, action, acting, humour, romance, everything you can ask for.It's been a long time since I've left the theatre with the feeling of joy after watching a movie.

title: Surprisingly good
text: Just for an hour or so I was reminded of the old Fall Guy series and it made me laugh. Brings me back to being a teenager again with daft plot lines and no real story but I still somehow loved it.Look if it's serious you want the forget it, but if you want fantastic stunts and non stop action then this is it. This for me was a great reminder of better times when everybody didn't take things so serious and not everything had to have a deep meaningful message.I am going to be singing that theme tune all week now but why did you change the words so much.Fantastic fun and I can totally recommend it!

title: Thoroughly enjoyable comedy
text: This is exactly the type of film that we all need these days: A fun and enjoyable comedic romp with many funny and interesting characters.I used to watch Lee Majors in the Fall Guy many moons ago, so I was unsure how this remake would be. Well, I thoroughly enjoyed it! Lots of humorous scenes, a somewhat cohesive storyline, and sweet interactions toons between the main characters. All this interspersed with action and comedy based around the stunt man (and woman) job.If you're looking for a fun, light, humorous movie to take up 90 minutes of your evening, I would highly recommend The Fall Guy.

title: Action packed but unbelievably boring
text: We regret not having left after the first half hour.The cinema was almost empty for the showing.There's next to nothing of a plot or story to hold your interest. With the film receiving ratings over 7.5 on average, it makes me wonder whether the ratings are manipulated. I regret not delving deeper into the available films before choosing this and deciding to pay for tickets to watch it. Don't waste your time.More characters are required so I'll add an in interesting fact: Honey never spoils. Archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still perfectly edible.

title: The Fall Guy
text: One of the best movies I've seen in a cinema in years. The first half an hour of the movie is pretty sluggish and dull, nothing special nothing new. However afterwards it gains momentum and builds this random but engaging storyline which really ties the movie together and makes it feel thoughtful and atmospheric. It's also cool to see a movie shot in Sydney since not many films are filmed there. Although the movie doesn't have a deep creative plot it produced superb action shots and balanced between dialogue story building scenes and action. I also like that they filmed production in the film similar to "Once Upon a Time in Hollywood". Overall worth watching.

title: Truly a Multi-Faceted Delightful Movie!
text: It is rare that I go to the theater to see the same movie twice, but I did just that with The Fall Guy. .Two seasoned actors (Blunt and Gosling) lead some other quasi-prominent actors through a plot that actually has more plot than I actually expected it to have. When talking about the movie to a friend, I told them that I thought this movie did a delightful job of combining a love story, a mystery/thriller, a superb comedy, and some mega-action drama altogether in a package as an honorable tribute to the real stunt people of the entertainment world.Be sure and wait at the end to see some of the outtakes because they are fun!

title: This happened and then that happened and then this happened again
text: Why was this so bland? No heart. No inspiration.I don't buy the homage to stuntmen thing. It is just an excuse to have lots of stunts.I don't buy the romance between Blunt and Gosling at all. In love one minute, hating each other the next. Don't get me wrong, the actors are amongst the most engaging working in Hollywood at the moment, it just never made sense.The detective part of the story was nonsense. Just an excuse to have lots of silly 'comedic' set pieces.None of it kept me enthralled.The plot was a symphony of 'and then' writing as called out by the South Park boys.In short watch the original TV show. That made sense.

title: Summer movie magic !
text: I certainly don't understand why this movie is not being seen. We waited because I am not an opening week person. But wow , what a fun movie. As has been noted , the chemistry between the two stars is great. Nice tribute to couple of tv shows , great action , nice comedy , and a great showcase for stunt work. Thank you stuntmen and women, your work is dangerous and amazing. It really does make action pictures what we go to see. In addition to the two leads , Ryan and Emily , Winston Duke does a fine turn as the stunt director/ friend . Even the pre movie segment with director and Ryan was great. I've come to really like these " thank you's" . I want a sequel, please give this a look in theaters. Final word , 👍 .

title: Quite a fun movie
text: I was pleasantly entertained throughout the movie. I knew that I wanted to see this movie since I first saw the previews and the director has delivered.While the plot is nonsensical and characters are cartoonishly absurd, it is packed with movie references and humour.There are only a couple of scenes towards the end that I thought were a bit too long or unnecessary, for the rest, it worked like clockwork.Ryan Gosling and Emily Blunt are both the chemistry and the ability to convincingly sell their characters to keep the story moving.If you enjoy Deadpool like comedy and silly goons fights with even sillier motivations, then this movie will not disappoint.

title: Yaaaaaaawn!!!
text: My debut review is going to be on this incredibly boring film! I just had to.We've seen countless movies like this one before. The action scenes are repetitive and the dialogue is artificial!I understand that the concept behind the movie is unique - the 'fall' guy. However, the plot was just not it at all! There were several ways I feel they could have spun the story to create a sweet movie. It's a shame to see such a promising concept go to waste.This movie is for people who enjoy action movies without any depth or substance to the storyline. Trust me, there's nothing new or exciting here. I couldn't even bring myself to finish watching it.Please take my advice and skip this movie! Ignore! Ignore!! Ignore!!! Don't say I didn't do nothing for you.

title: This is made for action fans
text: The Fall Guy was an amazing movie. We really enjoyed it. Ericka liked it and she Hates rom coms. Emily and Ryan did an excellent job, it was fun and the stunts were WILD. Hannah was hilarious. As was "Pietro Maximoff".The plot was fairly straight forward with a few somewhat predictable twists. As a stunt man myself I could completely empathize with the character. The action sequences are some of the best you're going to see this year. Reminiscent of Mad Max. And that my friends was clearly the point. People putting their bodies on the line for your enjoyment. This is what I go to the movies to see. Action, Fun with a little heart sprinkled in. It was well worth the money.If you like action and your heart is not COMPLETELY frozen over by the current dating scene you'll prolly like it as well lol. Please watch this, rent it, buy it whatever. We gotta support the movies like this or we won't get many more of them.

title: So far one of the best movies of 2024
text: The Fall Guy is easily top 5 most entertaining movies of 2024 at the time of release. I only have positive things to say about it. The Fall Guy made stunts look cooler than ever, and we even got to watch Ryan Gosling behind the scenes of him performing his own stunts for a movie about stunts. The action was a little slow in the first half, no surprise, but was top tier for the last hour. The comedy wasn't balls to the walls funny, but the amount used fit perfectly with the tone making it nearly as funny. It's a shame that Ryan Gosling doesn't do more action/comedy, because he is really, really good at it. Unfortunately, I did have outrageously high expectations which hindered my viewing experience, but no complaints as a whole. I fully recommend The Fall Guy to anyone because it is just so enjoyable. It even took a page out of John Wick Chapter 4 with the "nuts" dog.

title: The Unity of Ken & Kitty
text: I really enjoy this movie, everything is in place and kinda work together to entertain the audience. It's not that type of movie where you have to think hard to understand what's going on. The story isn't that complicated but the visuals that they show with the stunts are mind-blowing. We kinda see how Hollywood works behind the scene (and I do think that is based someone's real experience). I like how unique this movie is and how Ryan Gosling portrays the character. He just proves how creative he is and I really like it.I put this movie as one of my favorite this year (though it's just May).

title: shockingly boring
text: Its more silly romance for teens than actual comedy, If you expect to laugh out hard, you wont.I have watched this and then watched Furiosa, and for both movies to have similar rating is insane. I don't know how you guys rate movies anymore.We left the movie when there was 30 minutes left because we were literary falling asleep.This is a type of movie you would wanna watch on Netflix in 1 or 2 years when there is nothing left to watch. (and still regret wasting 2 hours of your life).Disappointing really. Because I love the actors and I thought this movie had potential but the plot is just so thin and the jokes are so bad that it is just not worth it.

title: There SHOULD be Oscars for stunts.
text: I'm a simple woman. Ryan Gosling in a comedy role? I see it. This movie was right up my alley, but it exceeded my expectations. Phenomenal stunts, an excellent and well-used soundtrack (I love me a melodramatic rock/pop ballad), a solid plot, great comedic and romantic chemistry between Ryan and Emily, and tons of laughs overall. Perfect summer flick.Also, if you're any level of cinephile, you'll love all the references in the movie. They directly quote and cite to a bunch of movies and I'm sure there are plenty of references that were more subtle that I missed. And then I love that Ryan and Emily's characters discussed this in the film - making a movie for those who are more intense about a cinematic experience and those (I'd consider myself amongst this crowd) who appreciate movies at a more surface level, and having it be enjoyable for all.

title: Please get me out of here!
text: I'm halfway through the movie right now, and I want to leave. I remember when I saw the preview, I thought it would be very entertaining. It's not.I thought it would be non-stop action, but it's boring and dumb. And the shame of it is Ryan Gosling is a wonderful actor. What a waste of his talent.I'm probably being very rude by providing my review now, but then again, there's not many people in the theater. Hannah Wigginton(?) is terrible in her role.Also, Gosling's character is a stunt man, not a fighter, yet somehow he knows how to fight. I'm advising you to save your money and when you see it on streaming, you'll thank yourself and me for saving you money.

title: I mean come on Ryan and Emily together
text: Ryan is just hilarious, specially when he plays funny dumb guy. He is just awesome and Emily is gorgeous and just crazy good actress, together they had so much chemistry that makes me wonder if something happened in the set" wink wink". If you like Ryan's other movies that he plays funny dumb guy you will love this. It's very funny, romantic but not corny or over the top bs. Full of cool action and it shows how the movies are made by Stunt doubles. How much beating those men and women make to make these action packed movies. It's crazy how underpaid they are and how overpaid actors are. I'm glad they showed some love to them in a movie.

title: Great action, romance, humor, best show in a long time
text: I loved the fall guy series. I was a huge Lee Majors fan. So i was skeptical about this movie, but Ryan Gosling did a wonderful job of keeping character. It had action, romance, humor, it was a great movie. Definitely worth watching. I love this movie. And the best part was that my fiancé loved the movie because of the romance.This is like the movies we had before all the streaming companies took over. And of course Emilie Blunt is really spectacular with her acting. I would venture to say she is one of my favorite female actors because she is so talented. It was a good paired movie. Great job.

title: A Silly Action Flick Advertised as a Rom Com; It's Not a Rom Com
text: Big disappointment."Fall Guy" has been advertised as a romantic comedy. Of course it includes action scenes but I thought that there would be an equal mix or maybe more on the romantic comedy side."Fall Guy" is a comedic action movie. It's a guy movie. Emily Blunt is a star and she is rarely onscreen and given very little to do. The movie mocks her as stupid and not understanding men and having silly, inappropriate, girl emotions. Ew. Girls have cooties, according to this movie.For me this movie was a complete waste of time and I'm really pissed off at whomever decided to disseminate a false advertising campaign.If you are an action movie fan or a fan of kindergarten level comedy this movie might be just your cup of tea. Not a problem for me. For me the problem is the false advertising.

title: ACTION!!!. AMAZING
text: Like any craft in life, being a stuntman takes passion, significant risk, and unbelievable Dedication. This film brings the idea of what it takes to create a great action film or tell a story with lots of action and absolute triumph; I am in awe Of how these movies are made. It takes so much passion and precision to pull off all these moves and people on fire, free falls car wrecks, Crazy fighting scenes just a beautiful art. Before watching this movie, I watched THE Show Action on Peacock Giving me the inside, look of the life of a stuntman or woman. Very cool and hats off to the entire crew that made this movie possible. And now the younger generation can have something to dream about. Great job!

title: I've Never Seen This Before
text: Seems like every time I sit down to watch an action or romantic comedy movie - about 30 minutes in, I find myself saying, "Well, I've seen this before." In fact, I was beginning to believe that there is only so many ways to make a film that tells an engaging story in these cinematic genres.Enter, "The Fall Guy."From the opening scene, it immediately becomes obvious that you are witnessing movie magic. Since the 1970's, I've lost track of the number of romantic comedy and action movies I've watched, but none of them are as original, smart, sly, funny, action-oriented, and emotional as The Fall Guy. This film is literally firing on all thrusters while it hits ALL of the above adjectives - in a single movie.Sitting in a theater in 1979 watching "Alien", I marveled at the jump scares that movie elicited among the packed audience. Now, in 2024, The Fall Guy grabbed me in just the same way, but instead of jump scares, I found myself astonished by the ingenious plot twists; staring in awe at the insane stunts that were sprinkled throughout the movie, erupting in laughter at the constant barrage of comedic elements, cheering triumphantly during the car chase scene involving the dog, and feeling that tug of emotion when (for just a moment) Jody believes that all might be lost. I particularly enjoyed the way The Fall Guy paid homages to past movies in an almost Jeopardy-esque way, daring us to guess the name of the old film before it is revealed to us - this becomes a humorous running motif throughout the movie.In terms of a virtuoso performance, one might compare this movie to True Lies, but I believe The Fall Guy resonates better with its audience than James Cameron's film.Here we find Emily Blunt giving a leading lady performance that immediately and authentically connects with the audience. Her incredible talent is on full display from start to finish.Ryan Gosling has truly given us a number of unique and distinct character portrayals over the past decade, and he delivers once again here - but this time he unleashes his athleticism at a sustained peak-performance level I've never witnessed from him before. This movie simply would not work if he had not been able to convincingly embody the character and aura of a stunt man in the way that he does.Simply put, I've not had this much entertainment fun at a movie theater since the 1990's. Rating: 9.5 out of 10.

title: Waste of talent & opportunity
text: Anyone who saw Ryan Gosling's beautifully timed comedic performance in The Nice Guys must have looked forward to this Action romp. Nothing against Gosling or any of the cast but the barely credible plot - even for the genre - and the complete lack of genuinely funny lines, gags or set pieces left this reviewer at least leaving the theatre just shaking my head in disappointment. What a waste of a great cast, extravagant set pieces and budget. Did anyone actually read the script and let out the slightest laugh. The two leads did their very best but the only thing laughable was the fact this remake of the 80's TV show got made in the first place. And I so wanted to like it.

title: A love letter
text: I no longer need to do my crunches today because my abdominal muscles are sore from laughing beginning to end that is making me want to see it all over again because it's too funny and non stop octane.David was and is the perfect director for this (John Wick) being he used to be a stunt man to go on to direct good gems and write. This is his love letter to stunt men as the closing song plays. The screenplay has to be nothing short of amazing but I'm not so sure it works as much without Gosling. He is that guy. His charm and brilliant comic timing elevates every movie he's in ten fold, imo.If you want to laugh for two hours escaping reality while also appreciating the stunt comminty (GIVE THEM OSCARS ;). Bravo to Gosling as always, Jean Claude, and of course Emily Blunt, as usual! Incredible movie that can't ever be remade.

title: Pure FUN
text: The Fall Guy is nothing but pure fun.The writing is not always great, but the actors elevate it whenever the script fails to deliver. The action is amazing except for one secene where they used some strange effects. The acting performances are just great. Ryan Gosling is at his top.The movie is shot very well. The camere movements are dynamic, which elevates the excitement. The film is also well paced and the stunts are amazing.The characters and the story is not a big deal, but most of the jokes deliver. It's not the best movie of the year, but my personal favourite so far. We need more movies like this, movies that give you positive energy, that are just pure fun.

title: Stellar performances
text: The Fall Guy is a cinematic delight that shines with its captivating storyline and stellar performances. Ryan Gosling effortlessly embodies the role of a stuntman, delivering a performance that keeps you engaged from start to finish. Paired with Emily Blunt's undeniable charm, the chemistry between the two leads elevates the film to new heights. The action sequences are masterfully executed, keeping audiences on the edge of their seats while the foot-tapping music adds an extra layer of excitement. From the captivating cinematography to the well-crafted dialogue, every aspect of "The Fall Guy" comes together seamlessly to create an unforgettable viewing experience.

title: The Fall Guy boasts a promising premise, but it succumbs to overproduction, poor editing and an abundance of cheese
text: My wife and I caught The Fall Guy (2024) in theaters last night. The plot centers on a stuntman who, after a debilitating accident, loses both his confidence and direction in life. A year later, he receives a call for help for the woman he once loved, prompting him to return to the movie industry to help her. However, upon arrival, he discovers ulterior motives at play, leading to unexpected twists and turns.Directed by David Leitch (Bullet Train) and featuring a star-studded cast including Ryan Gosling (Barbie), Emily Blunt (Oppenheimer), Aaron Taylor-Johnson (Kick-Ass), Winston Duke (Black Panther), and Hannah Waddingham (Ted Lasso).The Fall Guy had the potential for a compelling romantic comedy, but unfortunately, the excessive $130 million budget leads to over-the-top scenes and cheesy moments in almost every frame. Despite solid performances from the cast, the film suffers from poor editing and unrealistic storytelling. While there are a few good lines and a touching love story, the movie is weighed down by drawn-out scenes that diminish its impact. Even after the apparent conclusion, the film continues with behind-the-scenes shots during the credits and additional scenes post credits, prolonging the experience unnecessarily (even if I did enjoy the behind the scenes shots).In conclusion, while The Fall Guy boasts a promising premise, it succumbs to overproduction, poor editing and an abundance of cheese. I would rate it 4.5/10 and recommend it only with appropriate expectations.

title: Funny, Action, Exciting all balled into one
text: This movie reminded me of the original The Fall Guy and loved the Cameos. I can't put my finger on what I loved about the film but it was excellent.Gossling and Blunt had amazing chemistry and the soundtrack reminiscent of the 80s. Oh and the stunts were awesome to watch.The plot was well done. I didn't catch on until about mid film so it was hidden well inside the action.The characters were also developed enough to make you like the good ones and hate the bad ones. Plus a man with a man bun is in it and he pulls it off very well.Watch this one, you will love it. Might even be one of the best films out of that cesspool Hollywood in some time.

title: excellent film
text: Loved this film. One of Ryan Goslings best. Emily Blunt was a great choice too. Real good chemistry between the two and my favorite new stunt guy Francois absolutely smashed it. Hope to see Francois on screen again. Some of the lines were quite memorable, falling through a window hurts, getting set on fire hurts but not being with your hurt the most. None of those cheesy one liners you expect from Hollywood although it does have Jason Mamoa in it if anyone wants those too to finish it off which made for an even funnier ending. The stunts were actually really impressive, fair play to the stunt guys in this one. It's action packed with great pyrotechnics. A must watch for 2024. And did I mention Francois? Yeah I dare anyone not love Francois.

title: Solid walk out movie
text: There's only a handful of times where I regret not turning to my husband and asking him if he wants to walk out.We both said it immediately after.I really wanted this movie to be good. Ryan is somewhat the only saving grace to it. Otherwise, it's an even lower rating. And look, I don't mind silly and cheesy, if it's done right. This was awful writing and an awful story. I even got high trying to enjoy it more and I think made it worse. I only laughed at one part, for 2 entire hours. And that sucks. They're all really good actors, just given a really awful script.Highlight: eye candy with Ryan and ATJ.This one was very painful to sit through.

title: Filled with action
text: There's hardly a flaw to be found in "The Fall Guy," as it delivers a compelling narrative filled with heart, action, and suspense. The story of a stuntman striving to prove himself to the love of his life, who also happens to be the director of the film, is both heartfelt and exhilarating. With each twist and turn, the film keeps viewers guessing, eager to discover how it will all unfold. To reveal any spoilers would be a disservice to the film's brilliance - it's a journey best experienced firsthand. In my book, "The Fall Guy" earns a perfect score of 10/10.amazing movie Dont miss to watch it.

title: Cinematic gem
text: The Fall Guy is a captivating cinematic gem that promises an exhilarating ride for viewers of all ages. Ryan Gosling's charismatic performance as a stuntman-turned-hero is nothing short of captivating, perfectly complemented by Emily Blunt's undeniable charm. From heart-pounding action sequences to poignant moments of romance, the film effortlessly weaves together various elements to create a truly unforgettable experience. With its fast-paced narrative and infectious energy, "The Fall Guy" is sure to keep audiences on the edge of their seats from start to finish.really really awesome movie don't miss it.

title: START A LITTLE BORINGE,THE END IS PERFECT
text: The start of the movie a little bit boring but the end is crazy i have fun and love this movie,Ryan Gosling performance was so good and emily blunt the best actres, Ryan Gosling is the goat. The start of the movie a little bit boring but the end is crazy i have fun and love this movie,Ryan Gosling performance was so good and emily blunt the best actres, Ryan Gosling is the goat.
