title: The rom/com that doesn't pull any punches
text: I honestly didn't even know about this movie until recently, but hubby had been talking about a comedy action movie that he's been seeing tons of ads for (The Fall Guy).I'm so surprised that I hadn't heard of this movie! I'm wondering if the marketing was geared to a more masculine/action heavy audience. From a middle age woman perspective, it's got everything that I'd also look for in a movie. It's got a strong lead female, who isn't half naked, well written love story, that isn't cheesy like all the holiday movies.... Characters that have great chemistry on screen. And tons of fun action that isn't gory, bloody or just for using effects.Overall, I think this movie could of done way better in theaters if they marketed it for what it is - a rom/com action mix.If you're into that sorta thing, give this one a go.

title: How
text: How is this movie rated so high? How is this movie portrayed as a version like the tv and it's zero like it. Love this show. 28 minutes into this and I am no longer wondering why movie theaters are shutting down. Spend a lot of money on a flick that is start packed with little delivery. Falling flat is an understatement.Jokes are weak. The action is lame. I didn't expect this to be an award willing movie but damn. I did expect a lot more than this delivered.Please get better writers in Hollywood. This is getting ridiculous. And for the love of goodness get that man a cup of coffee. Gees. Thx.

title: Not perfect but pretty still great!
text: A great popcorn flick with something for everyone. Not a chick flick & not a dude flick, the elements for dudes the chicks will still like & the elements for chicks the dudes will still like, as they all tie together. Starting with romance stuff, Ryan Gosling & Emily Blunt's chemistry is great although I admit I woulda liked to see a little more bickering in their early banter, maybe her be a bit more annoyed with him in the beginning for longer... that kinda stuff always makes the payoff better & adds a certain charm. I think most people expected a little more of that from the previews. For some of that "Romancing the Stone" vibe. (Where the 2 leads pretend not to like each other or at least in this case where she pretends not to like him while he clearly likes her.... but she let's up on that kinda early imho.) Obviously ya don't want that for the whole movie but it'd help if there was a touch more in first half. This is a bit of a nitpick though, & yes there's def still a touch of that. Their chemistry isn't built as much around that is all, i kinda wish it had been cuz it woulda been fun to watch some scenes like that, for added comedy, but there's def still chemistry & it's pretty darn great. Ur completely rooting for them by the end & it works.As far as the action/stuntwork, it's pretty great although there's no extended one-shots like Leitch did in Atomic Blonde or any sweeping grand stunt-fight choreography if ur looking for John wick or Matthew vaughn-kingman-church scene kinda stuff, or John Woo bullet Ballet style or anything like that but there's a record breaking car-roll and some great action all the same. It plays very well, looks great, stylish, & most of all, the story is set against a backdrop that pays homage to all the unsung heroes in the stunt world. Anyone who likes seeing "movie-within-a-movie" kinda stuff will enjoy that too.Don't expect a super realistic plot, this is all about fun, action, adventure, romance. I'm not gonna drop any plot/story spoilers.Musically, there's also a great classic Kiss song that gets used throughout the movie and builds up to a grand epic version in a crucial scene & personally as a fan of exciting music scores/soundtracks (& loved the 80s vibes of the trailer songs) ima HUGE fan of that kinda thing, and loved how it elevated the action. Not enough catchy music in action movies anymore. They hold off then at the climax cuz they already used the "epic" version by then, & so I kinda wanted more banger music during much of the climax but then they bring back the raw version of that track at a good moment. I know to some reading this u could care less about music but I'm a big believer that it subconsciously elevates the visuals when it's powerful.If ur looking for a connection to the TV series there's an Easter egg for ya to pay respect & homage & nod if ya stay tuned but the movie isn't about that so try to enjoy it for what it is.In conclusion this is a fun summer popcorn blockbuster that yes could use a few improvements but it's also kind of a banger & should leave most people leaving the theater with a smile, and possibly feeling a bit nostalgic for how movies used to make us feel. Don't set ur expectations thru the roof. That's probably the only thing that could leave anyone disappointed. Just expect some fun.

title: Not what the trailer promised
text: I went into this movie with certain expectations based on the trailer. In linear fashion, movie's star comes up missing (presumably on a bender), star's stunt guy goes to get him, finds out Star has gotten mixed up in shady dealings, stunt guy has to escape the bad guys, rescue the Star from said bad guys, all so he can save the movie production he's in & win the affection of the lady director. Stunt guy becomes The Hero, spoiled star is now The Damsel in Distress, & the director is both The Girl & The Queen whose kingdom The Hero saves.Except it's way more convoluted. Rather than having fun with the cliches I just describe, Fall Guy goes way out of the way to avoid them. Like around the world to get next door out of the way, & in about the most boring way possible. The action sequences are short, few, and warmed up leftovers from Leitch's better movies. The romance building scenes are overlong in a beat-a-dead-horse way. By the time The Betrayal happens, I felt like I was the one who was betrayed.There's some good bones here, & could've been a really fun movie, but ends up being more like something made by a committee of 14-year-olds.

title: Meet the expectations
text: The Fall Guy is a cinematic tour de force that exceeds all expectations. From its stellar cast to its gripping storyline, every aspect of the film is executed with precision and finesse. Ryan Gosling delivers a standout performance as the lovable underdog, while Emily Blunt is equally impressive as the object of his affection. With its adrenaline-pumping action sequences and heartfelt moments of romance, the film strikes the perfect balance between entertainment and emotion. Whether you're a fan of action-packed thrillers or heartfelt love stories, "The Fall Guy" is sure to leave a lasting impression.

title: Ryan Gosling Shines in 'The Fall Guy': A New Benchmark in Action-Comedy
text: IN the realm of cinematic experiences, every so often, a film comes along that leaves an indelible mark on its audience. "The Fall Guy" is one such film. It stands as one of the finest original action-comedy films I have had the pleasure of viewing in a long time.The film's lead, Ryan Gosling, delivers a performance that can only be described as perfect. Gosling, known for his versatility and commitment to his roles, truly shines in "The Fall Guy". His portrayal of the protagonist is both compelling and relatable, bringing a depth to the character that is rarely seen in action-comedy films. His performance is a testament to his immense talent and dedication to his craft.One of the standout aspects of "The Fall Guy" is the palpable chemistry between the lead stars. The interactions between the characters are authentic and engaging, making the audience feel as though they are part of the story. The rapport between the actors is evident in every scene, adding a layer of realism to the film that is truly remarkable.The narrative of "The Fall Guy" is filled with mystery and intrigue, keeping the audience on the edge of their seats from start to finish. The plot is well-crafted, with twists and turns that are both surprising and satisfying. The suspense is skillfully built up throughout the film, culminating in a climax that is both thrilling and emotionally resonant.The execution of "The Fall Guy" is also commendable. The direction is sharp and focused, with each scene serving a purpose in advancing the story. The cinematography is stunning, with each shot meticulously composed to enhance the narrative. The action sequences are well-choreographed and exciting, providing the perfect balance of adrenaline and entertainment.The film's comedic elements are seamlessly woven into the narrative, providing much-needed levity amidst the action and suspense. The humor is clever and well-timed, never detracting from the seriousness of the plot. Instead, it enhances the overall viewing experience, making "The Fall Guy" a truly enjoyable film.In conclusion, "The Fall Guy" is a masterclass in action-comedy filmmaking. With its compelling performances, engaging narrative, and flawless execution, it sets a new standard for the genre. It is a film that not only entertains but also resonates with its audience, leaving a lasting impression long after the credits roll. If you're a fan of action, comedy, or just good cinema, "The Fall Guy" is a must-watch.

title: Don't think, just pay for the ticket and laugh
text: This thing is mindless. If you can't laugh hysterically at car stunts, don't bother. That's the best thing this movie has going for it. Blunt keeps way too many clothes on, and as usual, we see lots of. Gosling. They spend WAY too much time just talking. I hate movies that feature lots of talking. It's supposed to be cute, and this is supposed to apparently be a rom-com, and I hate both. I thought I was seeing an action film. There definitely is action, but the plot and plodding way-over-abused "romantic tension" gets in the way of cars exploding. Lesson learned, if a movie features Gosling, and you are very normal guy, take a pass and leave it for the girls.

title: Would be much better if Blunt's role was mostly edited out.

Her problems are tedious and boring. However, if she was limited to a few minutes of screen time, it wouldn't be a problem. title: This is a masterpiece 👌

title: Poor execution of a good idea
text: "The Fall Guy" is the perfect example of a poorly executed idea. What initially made this film interesting was the idea that the stuntman would ultimately become the action star by going on this mission to find the missing movie star. This was the perfect set up to allow the stuntman to do a bunch of crazy stunts that were entertaining while also paying homage to the stunt community. Instead, this film delivers the most generic action sequences ever shown in film and doesn't even make them look good. Guys fall through glass, cars crash, a few things blow up but there isn't anything captivating about the visuals.Had this delivered on the action then the plot could have been forgiven. Unfortunately, that was not the case and the plot is revealed to be very weak. The central conflict that is supposed to drive the plot is very foolish which made the motives of the antagonist just the same. This resulted in the film having weak and undeveloped characters. The love story started off promising but quickly became very bland without any emotion to support it.The humor is very mild with only some chuckles to be had. It would be difficult to classify this as a comedy when the biggest comedic element was the "twist" reveal which was comedic for its lack of surprise. Some scenes dragged on for too long and there were too many references made about other films.The scenes which involved the movie making process were enjoyable. More of that behind-the-scenes insight would have made this film more interesting. It could have been an action film within an action film showcasing all that stunt people do. This could have been the ultimate action movie but instead it only has a good song to its credit (I was made for Lovin' You).

title: Really good!
text: I don't agree with the audience on this. There are some things I would change. I think some of the talking scenes were a bit too long but the action was amazing. Ryan Gosling was great as was Emily Blunt. It was weird seeing a movie that was filming a movie that was making a movie. All the cameos were great. All the movie references were great. There were a few plot holes in the movie which were a bit strange but overall I enjoyed it. If you are looking for a good popcorn flick that is fun i recommend this. The film is essentially a Romantic Action Comedy. There are things that could be changed but I can see the art in the film.

text: Now seems like a good time for Ryan Gosling to take a break and enjoy his wonderful life. He is cranking out too many movies too close together and is wildly over exposed.I read today that the studio that made this film spent $200 million on it. Some of the stunts are really great. But the story is lame. The characters announce their feelings. There is barely any comedy.I don't know who the sock puppets are that are giving this movie 10 stars. title: Nonstop fun
text: The easiest thing to say is The Fall Guy is based on the 1980s action show of the same name. Whether it is a reboot, an origin story for the main character (Colt) or a reimagining is unclear and probably unimportant.The TV show premise was a stunt man who takes on detective work as a side gig. Here Colt (Ryan Gosling) is getting back into stunt work and wanting to reconnect with his love interest (Emily Blunt as Jody). The detective task comes along eventually giving us enjoyable action in a relatively uncomplicated subplot.Besides the love story and detective subplot the movie also invites us backstage to view the making of Jody's movie project, giving us insight into the movie making process and the hype machine that is hollywood.The inside references are endless and I'm sure I missed many. More than a dozen movies are referenced directly as stage hands quiz each other with movie quotes and similar banter. More obscure references include a car jump stunt (such a stunt played a major role in the final season of the original show) and the name of the movie Jody is making: Metalstorm. A theatrical movie of that name came out in 1983 and is the worst movie I've ever seen in a theater.This movie tries to operate on all of these levels and it succeeds in all of it. The cast are clearly reveling in the joy they're creating and it shines out in every frame of the movie.Of course two stars of the original show (Lee Majors and Heather Thomas) get a cameo, and the torch is passed to a new fall guy. Hopefully this will be the start of a franchise.PS, stick around through the credits for video of how many of the stunts were actually done.

title: Ryan Gosling and Emily Blunt in a movie about stuntmen; what's not to love?
text: In an age where everything is CGI heavy explosion fests where nothing you see on-screen is real, a film like The Fall Guy is a rare commodity, making it all the more welcome. This film serves as a love letter to the unsung heroes of film: the stuntmen and women who risk their lives so the stars don't have to. It's also a well paced and written mystery, with some good twists and a solid balance between that stuff and the stuff with the film being made. Admittedly, the scenes of Blunt sniping at Gosling over their failed relationship were annoying at first, but they don't last too long and once we get past them, we get some conversations between them that are both deep and funny. And while not every joke lands (there's a running joke involving Gosling trying and failing to get a coffee that's lifted right from Hudson Hawk and doesn't even get a payoff in the end), the majority do exceptionally well. For example, while I don't usually care for when movies reference other ones, the parts where Winston Duke quotes different movies and Gosling names them got a good laugh. Speaking of, the cast is solid and works well together, especially Gosling and Blunt once we get past the awkward sniping scenes.Naturally, in a movie about stuntmen, the primary focus should be on the action and stunt work. Thankfully, thanks to the end credits, I can see that the majority of it was all done onset, which makes the action and stunts all the more intense and pulse pounding, especially the fight scene in the back of the truck and the climax. However, they also manage to fit in some great humor with the action. For example, at one point, Gosling is drugged, so in the following fight scene, sparkle effects are added to each blow, as well as another running gag for the next ten minutes or so where he keeps seeing a unicorn. Even the editing gets some good laughs. For example, in one scene where Gosling and Blunt are talking on the phone, she mentions doing a scene in split screen, and the rest of the conversation is shown in split screen. And of course, there are some awesome songs in the soundtrack, with the main theme being the KISS classic "I Was Made For Lovin' You".Overall, The Fall Guy was everything I hoped it would be: a fun, high octane action film where what you see on the screen actually happens. It's a shame it isn't doing well currently (there was barely anyone in the showing I was at), but hopefully, word of mouth will spread and it will pick up. If not, perhaps it will find new life on streaming.

title: Dull action comedy
text: Firstly, I am confused as to why this movie has so many 10/10 reviews on here. The way they are written seems almost like spam posts.Fall Guy follows stuntman Colt Seavers. After an accident filming for actor Tom Ryder leaves him broken and working a dead end job, Colt is surprised when a producer wants him back to help work on a movie his ex-fling Jody Moreno is making. The tension between these two ex-lovers escalates and Colt is asked to go on the search for the missing Tom Ryder, pushing him into a plot of mystery and intrigue.The movie juggles a "will they-won't they" rom-com plot whilst sending Ryan Gosling's character on a messy and unfocused adventure to find a missing actor. Aside from the third act which saved the movie slightly, the pacing is awful (2 hours was too long) and the dialogue was painful to watch.There is hardly any chemistry between Ryan and Emily. We are supposed to be invested in their love story but aside from a brief mention at the start of the movie and an occasional flashback for a few seconds there is nothing to believe in. Their exchanges of dialogue are terrible. Emily being cold and uninterested and Ryan mumbling through his lines. There are a couple of moments throughout the film where I could feel my mind slowly fading away and my interest levels dropping rapidly.A scene in which Emily keeps making Ryan do a stunt where he is yanked back into a wall on the set of a sci-fi action movie. After takes we have to watch them talk on megaphones back and forth, as if they were talking about the characters but really it's about them, over and over. It's not funny, it drags on for far too long and it does nothing to help the films pacing or love story angle.During a pivotal scene of plot intrigue the two leads have a split screen phone call. They discuss the movie they are making for a while and then sit down and debate the plot of Notting Hill. Thats it. Just mindless chitter about an old rom-com. Doesn't have any relevance to anything, move the plot forward or foreshadow much it's just more filler in this movie.The film has us believe that Colt (and all of the stuntmen on this movie set) are action heroes with John Wick style fighting capabilities. Ryan acts like Jackie Chan in Drunken Master, flailing about but at the same time in complete control. Able to take on multiple assassins and armed guards whilst also making death defying leaps and moves. Keep in mind this is a man who suffered a career ending back injury at the start of the movie.The only chemistry that really worked and parts of the movie for me were when Ryan and Winston Duke's character interact (they actually had chemistry) and Tom Ryder. An arrogant and self-centred, over the top action star played quite well by Aaron Taylor-Johnson.The biggest problem with this movie though is the story. There are a few action set pieces here and there which are mostly decent (expected from the director of Bullet Train and Nobody) and the third act goes all out in terms of special effects spectacle but the plot is bland, boring and the worst part: predictable.I was able to figure out straight away who the bad guys were and the issues whilst at the same time being incredibly uninterested. The movie drags so much, due to the bland dialogue and mystery elements which take far too long to be explored. By the time the third act happens which does help focus the movie slightly and bring everything together, it's too late.This film is listed as a comedy but it barely managed a chuckle out of me. In fact I was in a pretty full cinema and I don't think I heard anyone laugh. Not once.The stunt work is pretty good though and I appreciate the film highlighting the hard work and dedication this bring in creating movie magic. Although it does take away from the point slightly when the main character is part of the stunt team but more often than not you can clearly tell it's another person doing the stunts.Ultimately, The Fall Guy is a boring rom-com with lacklustre dialogue and terrible pacing. Some good performances scattered once in a while and an entertaining third act can't save this one.

title: Too long and no story to tell
text: What a bad film. There are far too many special effects and stunts, but that's not enough to disguise the poverty of the script, where nothing is surprising.The characters are lousy and cartoonish, and there are so many improbable stunts that it's almost like a superhero film.Probably having 30 minutes less can be helpful for aPerhaps 30 minutes less would have made this film entertaining at best.I thought it would remind me of the series from the 80s but apart from the names of the characters and the main hero's job, it doesn't.Another failed remake of an enjoyable series that I hope won't spawn any more sequels.

title: Falls Short
text: I thought A-Team was a Home Run and The Fall Guy was a show from the same time period with a much better cast on the small and large screen.I thought the story here was original and solid, but the script was weak. There weren't enough strong laughs and despite claims of a stunt extravaganza, there was a couple decent stunt offerings, but it reminded me of watching live action stunts at Universal Studios and not actually movie content. The action and stunts in both John Wick and Nobody far exceed what you get here.I had really high hopes for this and have been following progress for decades. I think Mark Wahlberg was attached in the early 2000's and like every action movie, The Rock was attached in the 2010's.It's just not a good movie despite having a good story and solid cast.This is better than the Roadhouse remake, but not by much.Best part of the film could be the Mid Credits scene, but even that didn't really fit, but it will make original fans grateful they sat through most of the credits.

title: Blunt's performances
text: The action sequences in ""The Fall Guy"" are nothing short of spectacular, showcasing the skill and precision of the stunt performers who risk their lives to entertain audiences. From high-speed car chases to adrenaline-pumping fight scenes, the movie delivers non-stop thrills and excitement from beginning to end. Ryan Gosling and Emily Blunt's performances elevate the action to new heights, immersing viewers in the heart-stopping intensity of each sequence.Their dynamic chemistry adds depth to the film's characters, making them relatable and endearing to audiences. You Can't miss this well written masterpiece.

title: Watch this
text: I love Emily and I love Ryan. They've proved that they are ass loveable together as they are apart.This movie is really, truly, very funny, entertaining. The combination of great action and comedy is in perfect balance. The plot is interesting enough on its own.I am pretty brutal when it comes to my ratings and I have a very specific idea about these genres. There is no other movie that comes te mind that had such a cool cast as this one, even Aaron Taylor Johnson is here, truly has good action and is truly funny. Love this movie. During the film I was thinking about when and with whom I can go a second time. This is a hard 9 (rating) for me!

title: Wanted to like and enjoy this
text:
This could have been a fun rom com, it kind of was.The CGI here was so distracting it totally took me away from the fairly fun and decent premise.This is it now i presume, not even trying to make things look real because there is an audience that doesn't.. know.. ??The romance here is fun and cute and that makes it a fun film, the stunts add to the bland tension and make it more interesting than it should be.Overall its not awful but because of poor cgi I was taken out of the experience.How hard is it to get your lighting right ffs.Lazy...
Actors were ok, story ok, good vibe poor, lazy, cheap CGI. It took me out of the moment.This is ideal for GFs to go watch a film with their BFs.Something for everyone resulting it nothing much for no-one....

title: Amazing movie
text: The Fall Guy is a breath of fresh air in the world of cinema, offering a unique perspective on the industry through the lens of stuntmen. Ryan Gosling and Emily Blunt shine in their roles, infusing the film with both heart and humor. Their chemistry is electric, elevating every scene they share. But what truly makes this movie a standout is its action sequences. From daring jumps to epic fights, each stunt is executed with precision and flair. It's a testament to the talent and dedication of the stunt performers who often go unrecognized. With its thrilling action and engaging story, "The Fall Guy" is a must-watch for moviegoers of all ages.

title: Not bad but also not particularly good
text: This film is a little frustrating in that it has all the pieces of a great film, it's just not actually great.Good acting, big budget, nice soundtrack, likable leads, everything a great film should have. It's just missing...something.I think a big problem is that the film leans heavily into the chemistry of the leads, and while Ryan Gosling and Emily Blunt are very charismatic individuals, they aren't with each other. I just didn't buy their chemistry. Less lovers, more siblings.The sound mixing of this film also left a lot to be desired. It's rare that I knock a film for technical flaws, but The Fall Guy sound was just not mixed well. Incredibly loud soundtrack and special effects often drowned out character dialogue. I probably missed 1/2 of what was said on screen.The plot itself was okay, but since I correctly surmised who the bad guys were in the film 10 minutes into it, maybe it was a bit telegraphed.The action itself was well done, and the technical details about stunt sequences were cool, but there just wasn't enough to this film overall to set it apart from other very similar films that have come before this one.The last thing I'll say about this film is my recognition that if this came out 10 years ago, it would've been a major blockbuster. Streaming has ruined people's desire to see these kinds of films at the theater, and I don't know if we'll ever get it back again.

title: Must watch

title: Pleasantly surprised
text: I'm not into action movies much, only go see them with my hubby if I'm REALLY bored, but I saw this trailer and said "that looks interesting" so he jumped on the opportunity to take me. FUNNY story that actually was pretty good because I couldn't guess what the plot points were until near the end. THough kinda campy levels of violence/action throughout the movie, I'm still happy with it and recommended it to all my family, especially Gen Xers (though I never watched Fall Guy TBH).

title: Welcome to the 21st century cinema

title: A theatrical experience is well worth it!
text: The Fall Guy" is an emblem of why we go to the movies! This film was a total delight from start to finish, and will undoubtedly leave you with a smile on your face by the end. title: As good as I'd hoped it would be
text: David Leitch is one of my favorite people in Hollywood. Although, I am not working in the film industry, we seem to share the same passion: action, stunts, martial arts and humor. With Leitch it really shows in his movies.The opening scene, where he and Gosling address the audience was absolutely endearing!Bullet Train and Deadpool were fabulous, and I also had a great time with The Fall Guy.I love it, when Ryan Gosling doesn't play stoic types, but unleashes a broader spectrum of acting skills, like he did in The Nice Guys.So, go watch it. Maybe not a masterpiece, but close enough.And please, people like Martin McDonaugh, Shane Black, Chad Stahelski and David Leitch... we need you to keep making movies.

title: What's with all the high scores ?
text:
You know when you watch a Hollywood movie and you are drawn in by how good it is, this is just another Hollywood movie that does not deliver. The leads have no chemistry, everyone knows Emily Blunt is married to John Krasinski and Ryan Gosling does not match playing a stuntman, besides there is no back story flashbacks of him and Emily to relate to in what they had, besides the long run time and what the main focus of the movie is supposed to be, the Hollywood cliches of how everyone treats each other is a sad fact that bothered me in my being a production assistant on MR. Belvedere in how badly your treated.When I saw the title of this movie, it reminded me of the TV show starring Lee Majors and I thought it cannot be that good, well it delivered on that part. Let's be honest when you read what the movie is about, does it really draw you in, I turned it off about half way.The main focus of the film with all the unnecessary
stuff probably finally showed up, but at that point who cares anyways, stuntman should have been more of a theme here as they do so much and should be more of a focus in the credits, when they die that is when their talked about as Chris Pratt's stuntman was, show some more acknowledgment and do a better job Hollywood !

title: Great Film, great concept.
text: Fall Guy is a great film, the comedy aspect of it is just on the line of cringey and funny.The storyline itself can be predictable and to begin with i thought it was going way too fast, but it turned out perfect. There really isnt many issues with the film itself.The camera work and cinematics its the perfect mix too between trying to be serious and being a comedy film.I have a huge amount of respect for the directors of this film for not only making a film about the stunt man, who is most of the times overlooked, but also to then perform all of the stunts too and not use CGI on any of them.This is a film i would recommend over and over again.

title: What a fun movie!
text: Really enjoyed this film. Exactly what it appears to be. Fun. Fast. Funny.On a sour note, the old Fall Guy song was suppose to be the closing credits, but it's an awful bubble gum country version. Different and awkward lyrics as well. Lee Majors Sang the old the song with style. Waste of a great opportunity.Anyway. The cast is quite good. Nice chemistry between the leads. Decent supporting cast as well.Obviously amazing stunt work. Just, wow. Really some of the coolest crazy stunts I have seen in a while.Overall, I tested this very high. Again... Exactly what was advertised and expected.

title: You'll fall for this guy
text: "Fall Guy" (5/3/24, 2hr, $145M w/w, D/David Leitch) This was a fun movie, in a strange category of romcom/action, so it's the perfect date-night film - romance and comedy for her, action for the guys. Ryan Gosling had authentic chemistry with John Krasinski's wife, Emily Blunt, they had a good time which means we had a good time. Both play underdogs which we, the audience, always love, right? The movie also shows the devious power of deep fake photos and video to aid in the commission of crimes. The movie runs a kind of long 2 hrs so you may want to break it up into a two-part affair like me and mine did. This really is a fun, fast-paced romp - you should enjoy :-)

title: Is it a comedy nope because not funny

title: Well-written action romp
text: Very enjoyable, reasonably clever action comedy. The characters are interesting, as is the plot, and you actually become emotionally invested in outcomes keeping your attention and motivation. Fantastic, well-paced and well executed action scenes permeate, which is a given for a stunt movie.Gosling and Blunt bring stellar performances.The only complaint is that it's a bit lengthy for this style of movie, and there is a bit of "action fatigue" that kicks in during a viewing, where action starts to lose its novelty. It probably could have been pruned down a bit in ways that would have improved the end result.

title: The acting is unbearably bad
text:
Acting: 2
Dialogue: 1
Camera work: 5
Editing: 3
Budget: 8
Story: 3
Theme: 2
Pure entertainment factor: 4
Video quality: 8
Special effects: 7
Pacing: 4
Suspension of disbelief: 2
Non-cringe factor: 3
Lack of flashbacks: 5This tries to be comedy. Tries. All the comedic scenes that are supposed to make you laugh are cringe inducing and the issue is that that's basically all dialogue scenes. They are overproduced, the dialogue is extremely stiff and fake, and often everyone is just chit-chatting about nothing or screaming their lines. This feels like a movie made with a script that's 50 pages long. The rest is adlib. There are constant scenes where 2 characters are supposed have an awkward personal debate. Yet the cuts are overly fast, the music too loud, and the dialogue is horrible. The whole script is awful mainly because of the dialogue that feels like it's written by someone who has never written a script before. Someone trying to write a comedy for the first time ever without really understanding what makes a scene funny. So it feels like a cheap imitation of a mediocre movie.But then it's clear from the editing the producers didn't trust the story and acting to deliver so they overproduce each scene and cut it to bits. Everything feels extremely rushed yet the movie is overly long. Even the initial storyline kickstarting the plot is rushed via flashback and slow motion scenes. So many slow motion scenes everywhere! And then a 18 months jump in time where all this crucial plot development happened. They clearly had the runtime to tell a clear story yet just didn't. I can't even explain why. They had the actors, the budget, the runtime. They had everything to pull off a decent story. So the reason for the failure is just lazy people making the movie or no one actually making sure the quality is high. This is clearly produced, not directed.Also, the story makes no sense. What are the plans? What role does the police play?

title: Show the entire stunt in one shot
text: I am a big fan of this director's work on John Wick and Atomic Blonde, so "The Fall Guy" was disappointing. Leitch is hit or miss for me, anyway, since I hated "Hobbes and Shaw", don't care to ever see "Deadpool 2" again, and found "Bullet Train" just meh.But "John Wick" and "Atomic Blonde" rewrote the book on action scenes, so I expected something in a movie about Hollywood stunt workers that would rise to that level.Nope. What we got was the first hour full of a really boring, poorly written, poorly acted love story. I like Ryan Gosling a lot, but even he could not bring this script to life for me. In the entire first hour, we see two stunts... we don't even see the main stunt that starts the story rolling.In other words, this is not an action movie. Rather, it is a romance with mystery and stunts thrown in. Which would be fine if it had something original or slightly interesting to share, but it does not. Both the romance and the mystery are boring, tedious and awkward for an entire hour.Then, finally the action starts and honestly, I don't get all the hoopla. These are the exact same stunt sequences every film has, shot in exactly the same way. A car jumps a ravine, and we see maybe half of the shot but then it cuts to show a random mid-air shot and then a final cut to some random landing shot. Apparently this is called a "cut on action" or "match on action" shot (according to Google, anyway). The fight scenes are the same: punches are thrown in one shot, the connection is a different shot and the impact is yet another shot, etc.In fact, in this entire movie, every stunt is a cut on action except two (I only saw it once, so there might be more, but it's not a lot more).This is exactly the kind of TV action scenes I grew up with in the 1980s. There's nothing cutting-edge about it, except that it wasn't done in front of a green screen (I guess that's cutting edge in today's Hollywood). But that doesn't make it more interesting.You wanna make an homage to stunt people, show the entire stunt in one shot. That kind of camera work is what made "John Wick" and "Atomic Blonde" so much fun to watch over and over again.I doubt I will ever revisit "The Fall Guy". I'd rather watch an episode or two of the 1980s classic "The A-Team". I'd see the same action sequences and get a better story for my time.

title: Amazon
text: At the heart of ""The Fall Guy"" are its breathtaking action sequences, which serve as a testament to the unsung heroes of the film industry-the stunt performers. Their daring feats and precision choreography elevate the movie to new heights, setting it apart from other action films. Moreover, the impeccable comedic timing displayed by the ensemble cast adds another layer of enjoyment to the film, ensuring that viewers are entertained from start to finish. Their dynamic chemistry adds depth to the film's characters, making them relatable and endearing to audiences. Its unique premise centered around the world of stunt performers.

title: So fantastic
text: Finding faults in The Fall Guy is a challenging task, as it excels in nearly every aspect. The protagonist's struggle to prove himself to his beloved against all odds creates a compelling narrative that keeps audiences engaged throughout. Withholding spoilers, the film's conclusion leaves viewers eager to witness the outcome firsthand. Overall, The Fall Guy deserves a perfect score of 10/10 for its gripping storyline, stellar performances, and thrilling action sequences. Ryan Gosling's portrayal of a daredevil stuntman in The Fall Guy is nothing short of mesmerizing, while Emily Blunt's nuanced performance adds depth to the film's narrative. Together, they create a cinematic experience that is both thrilling and emotionally resonant.

title: Fun but...
text: This was entertaining and fun ... as long as it wasn't the scenes with Colt and Jody's sappy dialogues. It was almost painful to watch.Those bits seemed like such a badly written romedy script.The rest was quite fun but not much time given to build the villain's story or around the mystery plot.I watched the original series when I was too young to remember it much so I'm not sure if this one does any justice to it. It made me want to try and find reruns of it.Loved watching the stunts (which is worth watching on the big screen) and all and Hannah W is pretty great. Soundtrack was good too!

title: Best stuntman movie!
text: This has been the best movie about a stuntman because it gives details on what stuntmans do in the movie making process it was so good, funny and entertaining to all viewers who interested with this particular job that they do in the industry making.The actors, directors and producers were good in developing this movie to come out.I haven't seen to show of the fall guy but it was great because they got so many movie references on how people make movies come to life.The whole was fun including when Ryan gosling does the whole action stunts for this movie.This is why I would give this movie a 10/10 because the movies has some good influence on the movie. I saw this movie on May 26 of this year.

title: Works better as a tribute piece than an action comedy!
text: It shines the brightest as long as its acts are strictly restricted to showing great stunt work and mounting larger-than-life action set pieces.That shouldn't really come as a surprise, though, as this whole project was specifically envisioned to pay homage to one of the most brave groups of men and women who pull off implausible stunts day in and day out but seldom get the recognition they deserve.In that regard, it does a great job; no complaints, but the moment it moves out of its so-called comfort zone, the efficiency takes a hit and the output does not quite reach the lengths it hoped for.The story's lame; there's hardly any thought given to it. I had high hopes for the romance because Blunt and Gosling look so well together on screen and have organic chemistry, but that too failed to give satisfying results, mainly due to depthless writing and lack of ambition pertaining to the romantic aspect.That said, I did enjoy what Gosling did as the lead; he kind of saved the film, if you ask me.

title: It's self-aware, so just enjoy it
text: If you're looking for deep story telling, this is absolutely not the movie. At no point does this movie aim to tell a story that has not already been told; if you watch it in the theater, you are literally advised that this movie is a love letter to stunt men. And thus, a fair amount of the film is dedicated to giving you a glimpse into their craft and showing off what they can do.If you go to watch impressive stunts, funny dialogue, and a great soundtrack, you'll love it. Ryan Gosling plays his part to perfection (even if his part isn't that deep). If you're looking for dumb fun, go see it. You'll have a great time.

title: The Fall Guy is a must-watch
text: "The Fall Guy delivers a refreshing take on the action genre, celebrating the often-overlooked heroes behind the scenes - stuntmen. Ryan Gosling and Emily Blunt's chemistry ignites the screen, adding depth to an already compelling storyline. The film seamlessly blends heart-pounding action with genuine moments of humor, keeping audiences engaged from start to finish. With its stellar cast and pulse-pounding action sequences, ""The Fall Guy"" is a must-watch for any summer moviegoer."This is one cinematic experience that's as emotionally engaging as it is visually spectacular. A must-watch for anyone who loves movies that pack a punch both literally and figuratively.

title: What does this want to be?
text: In of the generation where the original Fall Guy TV series was stock Saturday afternoon viewing. It had a great mix of action, a cool leader character and awesome stunts. All done tongue in cheek.I've just finished this and boy, what a ham of a film. I recognise now that as a mid-fifties guy, I'm not its target market but that doesn't mean I can't enjoy puerile humour. That's not the point here. The characters are just plain lame. The plot is incomprehensible. But the stunts are great. And with the latter, anything is possible nowadays through CGI so don't put too much emphasis on this aspect.But regarding the two previous aspects - cast and plot, they need to be tip top or it's a flop. (I'm pretty proud of that one.)I almost suspect the director on this shouted to his lackey "Get me Ryan for the lead", meaning Ryan Reynolds but the runner mistook it for Ryan Gosling. He is so not a comic leading man. He's simply out of his comfort zone. It's as if his dialogue was written specifically for Reynolds.And Blunt certainly isn't a comic leading lady. She's better corseted up in some Victorian drama than this.I'd love to have reported a much better experience but sadly it isn't great. Some remakes shouldn't be remade.

title: Poor homage to stunt people
text: You would think that a film about a stunt guy would show us, at the end, who the stunt people were and what they did. Throughout the film there are references to the "unsung heroes" and the fact that the stunt people get no credit. What a great idea it would be to end the film with a tribute to them, the films they made, the stunts they created, the injuries they had, etc. They could have rolled it during the credits and took nothing away from the running time. I'm really disappointed that the film producers did to them just what they denounced in their own film. Shame!The only positive aspect was having Lee Majors appear at the end.

title: Death by a thousand paper cuts
text: I like Gosling. I like Aaron-Taylor-Johnson. I like real stunts. And unlike many reviewers I even enjoyed the director's previous film (Bullet Train) in parts. So this movie was a no-brainer for me. Unfortunately what I got was the most meandering love story I had to endure. I can not stress out enough how abysmal the love story is treated. You will appreciate Star Wars Episode 2, because that one was at least unintentionally funny. Here it kills the movie dead in it's tracks, whenever the movie starts gaining some traction. So don't expect fireworks coming from Blunt, Gosling or the action scenes.I appreciate the sort of behind-the-scenes tone the movie is going for, I can not tell if it's parodying or documenting the chaos surrounding modern blockbusters nowadays. On paper, this should be light-hearted fun, but in reality, every minute of it felt tedious. You can guess all the story beats from a mile away, the big twist included. Every stunt set piece feels like it's five minutes too long. And the constant cross-cutting between two locations (and tones) during an action scene never works. Specifically the stunts are underwhelming, because they made them look like they were heavily green-screened even though they weren't. But Gosling is basically dealing with a few henchmen here and again it feels underwhelming how the story and action unfolds here. The director shoots for being Shane Black and Michael Mann at the same time but lands somewhere on Tommy Wiseau/Michael Bay territory. The film itself can not decide if the protagonist is a coward, a real human, a caricature or a superhero, so it rolls the dice every five minutes. Everything is so in-your-face and tries hard to amount to something: be it the obvious music choices, the movie references & especially the tired humour.Gosling, Aaron-Taylor Johnson and Hannah Waddingham are the only actors chewing the scenery, and who barely keep this corpse of a movie afloat. Emily Blunt is terrible in this, I want to blame the writing, but Gosling is punished with the heavy lifting here and he mostly makes it tolerable, but even he can't turn a turd into a cupcake. There's tons and tons of dialogue which is supposed to be clever, meta or just quirky but it's trying too hard. It's one of those movies where you already checked out when the final act comes along and arguably the best action scenes are thrown at you, but all you want is for the movie to end already with it's tacky happy ending. This isn't a homage to the 80's and it's respective stunt work, this looks and feels like any other mid-movie from Marvel or Netflix.3 out of 10.

title: Shocking
text: How two big names like Emily Blunt and Ryan Gosling but their names to this is beyond me. It's seriously awful, absolutely terrible. My wife wanted to watch it, so I went along thinking I don't fancy it but it's got to be good with 2 big stars in it; hasn't it? Don't get me wrong, spoiler alert the music is great, right up my street. But the film itself, omg it is cringeworthy. Hey, maybe I'm missing something, but I couldn't wait for it to end and it was probably one of a very few movies I have seen which I wanted to walk out of. The plot is weak at best, more akin to an episode of a cheap 1970's show, the acting wooden, and the dialogue ........ I could go on, but suffice to say if you like a good movie give this a miss.

title: Not that good but it has its moments and is watchable
text: Ryan Gosling, he always makes it fun and aside from being a wet blanket in the original Sicario, Emily Blunt typically adds to whatever she's in. But this is just kind of poorly done. Poorly conceived, poorly scripted, with definite moments of "why am I still watching this movie". From my recollection there were two points in the film that I gave serious consideration to walking out because it was a go nowhere film. But Ryan Gosling's presence was just enough to tie reasonably fun scenes together to keep me there till the end. This movie is a Solid 5 plus stars, but it's definitely not a 6. The entire scene of where she's getting back at him and announcing it out to the crew and they go back and forth on it, it's just so hackish but I can't believe it's in the movie and really soured any and all of the romcom aspect to it. The stunts are okay but wholly unimaginative and relatively unimpressive for a movie about a stuntman called the fall guy.

title: That was brutal!
text: I didn't like anything about this movie and the only reason I didn't walk out after 45 minutes is because I was on a date. If you come to see cars blowing up and people being launched and no plot this just might be for you. I'm looking for a lot more for $16 per ticket. Don't say I didn't warn you. Total snooze fest. The woman I went with faked like she kinda liked it because she picked it. I'm still trying to figure out how this got such high ratings? I used to use these ratings to decide whether I'm going to go see the movie. Now I'm starting to wonder if people were paid to give such high ratings.

title: Waste of budget, I hope Emily Blunt didn't earn too much.
text: I watched the movie without any expectations. Apart from the introduction and final scene, nothing of note was seen.Boring dialogues. I would never play Emily in Blunt's films, especially if I were a director. I got so bored watching such a boring character.The only thing keeping the movie afloat was Ryan Gosling. For his sake, the movie was watched and continued, but no, it didn't catch on.The $130 million budget was wasted. As can be seen from his earnings, his hands appear to have exploded.He says there is comedy in the movie, but he couldn't make anyone laugh in any of the dialogues. It says there is drama, but there is no middle ground, love, even the lovemaking scene at the end was soulless in my opinion. I think Emily Blunt caused this.

title: A Nostalgic Dive into Classic TV with a Modern Twist
text: "The Fall Guy," a reimagining of the classic TV series, delivers a mixed bag of thrills and nostalgia. As a fan of the original show, I was eager to see how the filmmakers would bring this iconic story into the 21st century. While the movie does capture some of the charm and excitement of its predecessor, it falls short in a few key areas.What I Loved:Nostalgia Factor: The movie does a fantastic job of paying homage to the original series. From the theme song's modern remix to the cameos from original cast members, there are plenty of nods that fans will appreciate.Stunt Sequences: True to its roots, "The Fall Guy" excels in its action scenes. The stunts are well-choreographed and thrilling, offering a taste of the high-octane adventure that made the original show famous.Casting: The lead actor brings a fresh yet respectful take on Colt Seavers. Their charisma and physicality suit the role well, making for an engaging protagonist.Areas for Improvement:Plot Depth: The storyline feels somewhat shallow and predictable. While the action scenes are fun, the plot lacks the depth and intrigue needed to keep viewers fully invested from start to finish.Character Development: Aside from the main character, the supporting cast feels underdeveloped. The relationships and backstories that could add richness to the narrative are barely touched upon.Pacing: The film struggles with pacing, with certain scenes dragging on while others feel rushed. This inconsistency can take viewers out of the experience.Dialogue: Some of the dialogue comes off as clichéd and lacks the sharpness that could elevate the movie's overall impact.In conclusion, "The Fall Guy" is a decent attempt at reviving a beloved series, offering enough action and nostalgia to entertain, but missing the mark in terms of plot and character development. It's worth a watch for fans of the original, but it may not leave a lasting impression on new audiences.

title: No, no, no....doesnt work. Embarrassing.
text: Honestly, I'm not sure who is really in the drivers seat on US movies re: "the cringe factor" but this is off the scale. It an embarrassing hotchpotch of big stars, loads o stunts and explosions but ZERO chemistry, ZERO engagement with the plot, the stars etc. I love lots of movies the cast have already been in but this is simply not to my taste so I score 3/10. Many/most others score it much higher than me...so take this review as a bit of an outlier!. That said, the open, obvious 'corniness' of the opening 20 minutes must leave even the most dedicated movie fan feeling 'I paid for this why? I wanna stress that the main actors are great, have starred in excellent movies during their careers. I just find this not one of them :-)

title: GREEN SCREENS
text: If you have two eyes and a brain, you'd notice how many unnecessary graphics this film holds. When I point out "graphic" I speak about the laziness. It's hard to watch a scene, because every screen is a BAD green screen. A bad green screen is when you can see the very detail for the outline,Overall, this is a very hard film to watch, completely unbelievable, fun but COMPLETELY unbelievably cheap. I noticed an ongoing theme throughout the film the actors arms were not on their bodies. The couch was fake, the DOG is fake, Emily blunt and Ryan Gosling do not film together .this entire angle and perspective of film.

title: The Fall Short
text: Mildly amusing Hollywood tripe. A shallow stunt man action comedy romance which is average on the action, mostly mindless on the comedy and a romantic element that could have been more. It was kind of screwball stuff, maybe aimed at teens because I could barely sit through it. The soundtrack was completely top pop Taylor Swift and Kiss type stuff, utterly boring. Had a few humourous moments, the romance was mildly entertaining and then action was mostly crap but occasionally was cool. In fact my favourite part was seeing the real stunts in action during the end credits. Girls will enjoy it for the shirtless star, who is admittedly looking really buff.Not something I would want to watch again, i think I feel dumber now.

title: Enjoyable, forgettable popcorn actioner.
text: Strangely but predictably what I remembered most about this comedy actioner was the dynamics that exist on movie sets, that for a movie obsessed geek like me is pure nectar.We take it for granted that whenever we see a daring stunt or effective action set piece we forget what time, safety and athletics go into it.The romance between Ryan Gosling and Emily Blunt was okay but lacks the spark and zest of Emma Stone and whilst I'm a fan of Ms Blunt I felt Ms Stone would have been the better of the two. There's more banter between Gosling and Blunt-as seen in Crazy,Stupid, Love and La La Land. A zestiness, a spark. The script needed more one liners.The plot involving double crossing and murder actually works in the movie's favor and I was invested in it.Overall decent enough to pass a couple of hours.

title: Lee Majors cameo!
text: To be honest I wasn't too excited at first to see this movie, but I thought I would give it a chance as I was bored one afternoon. It turned out to be a very enjoyable movie going experience.The plot wasn't all that complicated of course, but I liked the action scenes and it was a good movie overall.Before I went to see it I looked up the cast on IMDB to see if any of the actors from the original Fall Guy were in the credits. To my surprise Lee Majors and Heather Thomas were listed. The fact that the legendary Six Million Dollar Man himself would make an appearance sealed the deal! It was great to see Lee on the big screen at the end, and I'm happy that they fit him into a funny scene along with Heather Thomas.Having said all that, this movie really delivers as far as action and stunts go. It was a well made movie and very reminiscent of the original Fall Guy. Ryan Gosling and Emily Blunt were great together.

title: Untitled
text: When they said on scene that you got no one else but Ryan gosling, that's already a comedy to cheering you on for a day.There is a long list of soundtracks for the film, for the most part its impressive.Thumbs-up is a stuntman 'BS' that's an interesting metaphor. I interpret that as thumbs-up imply its not ok but have to say it is so. So in real life if you wish to signal something otherwise, be careful to gesture this way. Especially while it feels not a right moment to brush things off.Shirley Temple is a toxic drink that's a good one.The illusional unicorn is cute, kelpie the dog is cuter.After watching this film, you have a better understanding why action films consume higher budget immediately, they cover stuntman insurance.Stephanie Hsu is in it. Makes my day. Love her dearly.Next time seeing an action film I will naturally urge myself not to feel an aversion even before it starts, just thinking how great a deal dangerous acts those stunts doubles have to go through, at least pay a silent tribute, it's so much easier to manage that emotionally from this point.I see everything is metaphorical these days, being a stuntman is one of the riskiest jobs that hardly presage what can be ended up. Life itself is a show, everybody is a stuntman, or stuntwoman, since we are all doubles of ourselves, wouldn't be rather beneficial if just lay low.

title: blends the right elements to make for a fun movie
text: In what's arguably a classic case of "too much testosterone syndrome," square-jawed stuntman Colt Seavers is a guy who literally gets paid to take it on the chin, problematic while trying to look cool in front of his girlfriend Jody Moreno, a camera operator with ambition to be a big-time Hollywood director. When an incident takes Colt out of the game for some time, he's lured back to take part in Jody's first movie: a big, blockbuster production that's already over budget, and naturally his presence makes it hard to keep things super profesh especially after the lead actor abruptly disappears. Clever script that's parodying the filmmaking process is infused with recognizable quotes and references, allows Gosling some funny soliloquies, and benefits from competent direction which doesn't let things get too serious. It runs long and the pace slows when monopolized by all the plot exposition, but there are plentiful laughs, great stunts (who knew?), plus Ryan and Emily look at ease playing characters you want to root for, even with the familiarity of their romance. ***

title: It's silly and witty--summer blockbuster stuff
text: "You fall down, you get right back up. How far would you go for the one that you love?" Jody Moreno (Emily Blunt)The Fall Guy, adapted from the 1980s ABC TV show, is blockbuster dangerous and romantic filling the need to see a summer actioner with intelligence that along the way teaches a loving audience about filmmaking. Bullet train's director David Leitch (a former stuntman from such films as The Bourne Legacy and double for Brad Pitt) and writer Drew Pearce have eloquently crafted a smart film about the essential visual component of the biz and an amusing love affair between Jody and Colt Seavers (Ryan Gosling), a Swiftie crying to Taylor's All Too Well, that makes a satisfying rom-com for the summer.At a time when AI is a flashpoint about veracity and authenticity. The Fall Guy more than enough makes the case for the human side of filmmaking even if part of the film shows how stunt making can be a vehicle for bad in real life. Regardless, this film celebrates real artists supporting real art.It's a movie within the movie about Colt, the appealing stunt man, and his ex-girlfriend, Jody, who directs a sci-fi movie with a lead, Tom Ryder (Aaron Taylor-Johnson), gone strangely missing. Colt is asked to find him and at the same time reignite his romance; it's complicated because it also involves a conspiracy. Echoes of the splendid Dune and light-hearted Cowboys & Aliens are all around.For those who like a mystery, The Fall Guy delivers. For those who love movies and die for peeks behind the scenes, the stunt sequences hold secrets of the art and craft that enhance appreciation. It features cannon rolls, pyrotechnics, smart dogs, etc. This romcom is like analyzing a challenging novel as it exposes some of the tricks and subtexts that make movies meaningful magic.You can't now do better for almost-summer blockbustering with a mind of its own.

title: Best Action Comedy in a Long Time - Ryan Gosling is Awesome
text: Casting is perfect- at the beginning you wonder why Ryan Gosling is the stunt double of Aaron Taylor- Johnson but in the end everything makes sense. The stunts are breathtaking, so much fun I have not the words to praise the producers/writers/actors/stunt performers enough- James Bond level, and not even CGI. The soundtrack is superb, the love story line is a hundred times better than Romeo and Juliet or Titanic but more modern, more realistic yet utterly romantic - almost Outlander level (with Jamie and Claire). The plot is great, too, not lame or predictable at all --there are many twists and turns. It's packed with puns and funny film references- I enjoyed it so much, I'm still laughing at some of them days after seeing the movie. The line "No offence- well, some taken"- will catch on, I'm sure, I've already incorporated it into my conversations. Oh my, Ryan Gosling is my new favourite actor. Watch it till the end credits, guys! The story is set in Australia, by the way, which is a nice change from the usual UK or US settings and yeah, some great accents all along:)

title: could be named - Tropic Thunder 2
text: And that is how this movie should be perceived, not some romance flick about movie making like the trailer might have you think, it is about how ugly the whole thing has become, there are plenty of hints that show how this "business" is run and what "normal" people have to deal with doing their jobs thereI'm actually a bit surprised that this got made at all, then there might be hope after all, but first they need to run out of whatever they are taking there at the top level to see how ridiculously bad they have been running the business for past 10+ yearsbtw, can't recall, but was there a disclaimer saying that all characters and events are made up? ;))

title: it's a masterclass movie
text: "From its adrenaline-pumping action to its witty humor, ""The Fall Guy"" excels on multiple fronts. The movie pays homage to the unsung heroes of the film industry while delivering an entertaining and engaging story. With its stellar cast and well-executed stunts, this film is a testament to the dedication and skill of stunt performers. ""The Fall Guy"" is a cinematic gem that deserves recognition for its creativity and craftsmanship."The Fall Guy" is not just a movie, it's a high-flying salute to the daredevils of cinema! Packed with action, laughs, and a stellar cast, it's a masterclass in stunts and storytelling. A must-see for its heart, humor, and homage to the real stars behind the scenes.

title: Unique action flick
text: This was a great date night movie. I tend to not love action movies but this was so enjoyable to watch. I loved that the movie was about a movie being made. It broke a lot of the third wall and it was nice to watch it from the view of a stunt man. This film was also very hilarious but the leading man Ryan Gosling always has an amazing way of delivering comedic lines. I thought the chemistry between Gosling and blunt was amazing. I think this has definitely been one of my favorite movies of the year so far. Given the type of film this does surprise me but I really don't think you will be disappointed if you give this movie a try.
